Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT
Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 55 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent has brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where bothplayers and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.
Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated, experienced professionals focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, or our respect and care for one another.
Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE
Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Senior Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our Data team. This person will report to the Data & Analytics Manager.
Your daily adventure:
Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages to address business requirements.
Design, build and maintain large systematic reports and perform one-off small pieces of analysis from multiple data sources (Tableau).
Design and execute high-quality business analysis of large data sets to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Communicate high-quality analysis and results to senior stakeholders.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics.
Identify, document and design data to be tracked.
Work with the Game Teams to support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.

Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS
Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.
Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science...). Master's degree or PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
4+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Strong experience using SQL language.
Strong working knowledge of R/Python scripting languages.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, MicroStrategy, etc.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics, fluency in data analysis and data storytelling.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising, or reporting results/analysis.
Experience implementing ML models with Python/R desirable but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details. Ability to multi-task and to adapt easily to change.
Good command of English.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.
What can make you stand out:
Experience in Agile Methodology.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.
Excellent communication & collaboration skills in multi-cultural environments to build effective working relationships.
Spanish or Catalan is a plus.

Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)
25 vacation days per year + day off in your Ubi-Birthday.
Flexible Working Hours & Working from Home policy.
Reduced schedule on August, Easter, Christmas and special dates such Sant Jordi and Sant Joan.
Flexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant.
Mobile device grant based on seniority.
Cigna private Health insurance.
Physiotherapist special rates in the office.
Professional development programs and tickets to international events.
English, Spanish and French free lessons in the studio.
Great discounts in our games.
Gym special rates and discounts in other services.
Nespresso coffee, organic fruit and other beverages.
Company parties and events.
Friday’s beers.
Relocation Package (when needed).
Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

About JLL Technologies

The Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry is at an inflection point. The technological disruptions that have already transformed retail, travel, and transportation have been slower to emerge here, but they are coming at full speed. JLL, a globally recognized leader in CRE, recognized these forces early, and is making massive investments in technology to transform both itself and the industry as a whole.

JLL Technologies (JLLT) is the tech arm of JLL, with the dual mandate of growing the company’s technology revenue while also driving market share and margin gains in our existing business. Our mission is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.

What this job involves:
We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our services with data driven solutions across the company to discover new opportunities, trends or hidden weakness in Real State. The candidate must be comfortable working with a wide range of data sources, internal and external, by using high-level modelling languages as R or Python. You must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights and communicate findings with effective and powerful data visualizations. The right candidates will have a passion for finding solutions hidden in data sets.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be able to:
Analyse data from JLL databases (relational and non-relational).
Use statistical computer languages (SLQ, R, Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Visualize data for stakeholders using: ggplot, carto, keppler, tableau, power bi.
Work with different functional teams (Data Science and Engineering) to implement models and interfaces.
Collaborate with model developers to implement and deploy scalable solutions.
Identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.

What you can expect from us

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.

Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Apply today!

In this role you will have the opportunity to work as a part of the Europe-wide Data & Analytics team, established in the IT Division, ensuring that all analytical units within the company can act on a unified, easy to understand analytical data layer. You will be the data related and analytical interface between tech and business in the company- the data architects, data integration team, BI and business data analyst.

You will focus on making the company data stack transparent for the different analytical areas and acting as a consultant during the development process and for the analysts with excellent analytic approaches
You would help to drive the Data integration process working close to the Product Teams, identify and provide possible data objects/ sources, develop business logic with the Business Data Analyst and provide data/information requirements from analytical point of view, that are crucial for later KPI transparency
You will work closely with analytical units to train their business analysts on the company data model and data stack to perform business challenges and to ensure that central concepts are well known and avoid inconsistency in data interpretation
You will work closely with the (Area) Product Owners and Data integration team regarding legacy data that are missing on the company data platform

What you will be responsible for:
Becoming familiar with the data landscape and in general with company business processes and strategy, with particular focus on data aspects, in order to provide and identify possible data objects/ sources
Offering expert advice to business data analyst to develop business logic
Developing and managing information, in term of providing de-normalized raw data and pre-aggregated data sets for all business notes, to support decision making
Working with cross-functional data and products teams, identify possible data sets that need to be available on the company data platform
Ensuring of data quality- finding issues, suggesting solutions and defining rules
Offer training and onboarding sessions for the analysts to ensure company knowledge re-assignment and make them familiar with the data stack and analytical tools
Developing professional reports, dashboards, and presentations with detailed analytical observations supported by data evidence

What we are looking for:
To work together in an optimal way in this position, we wish your qualifications to include:
Bachelor's degree in IT, computer science or statistics/ equivalent experience in data and business analytics
Solid knowledge about SQL and basic best practices with the ability to learn other analytical tools
Proven analytic skills, including evaluation, analysis, and visualization
good knowledge of Python or other programming languages would be an advantage
Good overview on available analytical tools
Understanding of OLTP vs. OLAP vs. Big Data
Understanding of Data Model concepts
Understanding of agile software development
Understanding of data technologies in Amazon Web Services
Business domain knowledge
Good understanding of analyzable data representation
Successful in a collaborative, team-oriented environment/ very good communication skills
Fluent English

What we are offering you
Become a part of our success story and seize the opportunity to take on a real challenge in a dynamically growing company where there is huge scope for development and short decision-making processes. We are offering you a versatile, international-facing role in our motivated team with colleagues from all over Europe. Our Spanish office is at a great location in Madrid, with great infrastructure links. Additionally, we offer many benefits such as:

✈ 28 labour days of vacation (plus December 24th and 31st)
Flexibility first. Enter from 7 am to 10 am and organise yourself.
Remote working flexibility (up to 60% remote).
Offices in the city center of Madrid. Modern working spaces with table tennis, foosball, fresh fruit, beverages and company events.
Private medical healthcare insurance for all our employees.
Continuous development through internal and external training opportunities.
Participate in the technology community through our meetups and conferences.
✏ English, German and Spanish language courses.
Discount in our zooplus shop for all our employees.
Referral program. You will receive a bonus by helping us finding the best talent.
We encourage diversity, meet our motivated and friendly teammates from over 50 nationalities.

Did we make you curious?

Then send us your application in English via our online application form

Job Title: EMT_054-21 Data analyst - Agència Catalana de Turisme
Job Description:
Quina és la missió principal?
Dur a terme el desenvolupament de la plataforma Intel·litur tant a nivell tecnològic com de càrrega de continguts a partir del que expressa el Pla de recerca de l’ACT i el Roadmap específic de desplegament de la plataforma tecnològic i el seu encaix dins l’ecosistema digital de l’ACT.
El desplegament correcte de la plataforma ha de permetre una transferència de coneixement òptima per al sector turístic així com afavorir la transformació cap a la cultura de la dada del personal de la pròpia ACT.
“PROJECTE INTEL·LITUR” dins del PLA DE MÀRQUETING 2018-2022
Funcions principals:
Seguiment del desplegament de la plataforma de dades amb l’empresa tecnològica desenvolupadora.
Vetllar per l’encaix de la plataforma a l’extranet i al CRM de l’ACT.
Plantejar els dashboards de sortida de dades de dades massives dins de la plataforma així com la llibreria virtual i l’espai de transferència de continguts.
Coordinar amb la tècnica de continguts el pla de continguts.
Actualització de les subscripcions a bases de dades de dades massives actuals i optimització de els variables requerides per assolir els indicadors marcats pel Pla de recerca de l’ACT.
Identificació de nous/ves proveïdors/es de dades massives per tal d’assolir els indicadors marcats pel Pla de recerca de l’ACT.
Responsabilitzar-se de la correcta distribució de la partida pressupostària dedicada a les dades massives.
Elaboració d’informes a partir de les dades de les plataformes existents, tant periòdics com puntuals si així es requereix.
Assistir a reunions i realitzar presentacions sobre dades turístiques.
PROJECTE “CULTURA DE LA DADA a l’ACT” dins de l’àmbit del PLA DE RECERCA
Funcions principals:
Donar suport a la unitat en programació de Power BI d’aquelles dades que requereixin d’aquest tractament: enquestes internes, dades de tercers (partners...).
Donar suport a la unitat en transferència de dades al portal de Dades Obertes
Acompanyament en la lectura de dades al personal de l’ACT.

De conformitat amb l’Acord del Govern de 13 de juny de 2017, sobre criteris per a la normalització de nomenaments i contractacions de personal temporal en l’Àmbit de l’Administració de la Generalitat de Catalunya i el seu sector públic, es tindran en compte prioritàriament les sol·licituds de les persones que acreditin un vincle preexistent de caràcter fix amb l’Administració de la Generalitat i el seu sector públic i que reuneixin els requisits de titulació i coneixements següents:
Estar en possessió d’un títol d’ analista de dades (dades massives), científic/a de dades o similar.
Coneixements avançats de l’eina Power BI i d’altres programes de Business Intelligence.
Tenir coneixements orals i escrits de la llengua catalana, nivell C de la Direcció General de Política Lingüística o equivalent.
Tenir coneixements orals i escrits de la llengua anglesa (B2 o equivalent).
Excepcionalment, en cas que no es presenti cap persona que acrediti un vincle preexistent de caràcter fix amb l’Administració de la Generalitat i el seu sector públic, es tindran en compte les sol·licituds de les persones interessades que compleixin amb els requisits especificats en aquest apartat.
Es valorarà
Tenir coneixements d’altres idiomes: francès.
Tenir les competències requerides pel lloc: capacitat analítica, habilitats comunicatives, comunicació interpersonal, orientació a resultats, orientació a client/a, treball en equip, organització i planificació, capacitat de síntesi, coneixements bàsics de maquetació de documents.

We like to think of ourselves as unapologetic tech innovators; this means we only build sites we can be proud of. Beauty is skin deep, but we know looks aren’t everything. We love a tight… security protocol, low latency and a banging user experience. The future of online entertainment cannot come soon enough – we want to Xcelirate it.
As a Data Analyst (Fraud), you will provide fraud investigation, prevention, detection, analysis and strategy for Xcelirate. You will use your SQL skills alongside other analytical tools to produce data driven recommendations that shape our fraud prevention strategy.
Fraud patterns change constantly, and our analysts' mission is to identify and take action on these patterns with the help of manual and automated tools to protect our customers and businesses from fraud.
We have grown to a community of diverse nationalities, perspectives and skill-sets. You’ll be part of an energetic, motivated team that hails from all corners of the world. We work hard; we play just as hard. Join us for one of the many offsite company gatherings and see for yourself!
Xcelirate is aggressively expanding (size matters, only because we dream big) and looking for bright, fun-loving candidates to join us. If you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you.
Hola! We’re looking for a Data Analyst (Fraud) to join our team in Barcelona.

What You Will Do
In this key role, you’ll be responsible for daily investigations, weekly reporting and performing exploratory analysis to form realistic and useful narratives from data. Additionally, you will be responsible for monitoring and reporting on our in-house fraud detection system. Your responsibilities will also include:
Conducting fraud operations, timely investigations, and manual interventions, acting as a fraud subject matter expert
Analysing customer behaviour to identify fraudulent patterns and provide customer insight using SQL and python
Developing, recommending, implementing and managing fraud rules to reduce exposure to new trends
Producing fraud reports for the wider business, including leadership teams
Contributing to the continued improvements of our wider fraud prevention infrastructure
Please note: All applications must be submitted in English


Requirements
General Requirements
Experience as either a data analyst, intelligence analyst or data scientist, within the fraud space
Strong analytical capability and the ability to transform data into actionable insights
Good SQL skills (1+ years) and accustomed to handling complex data structures from multiple sources and producing findings
1+ years of fraud prevention experience and experience with decisioning systems in an eCommerce environment
Self-starter attitude with strong commercial acumen
Desirable: Excel (2+ years)
Desirable: Google Analytics (1+ years)
Desirable: Knowledge of statistical analysis, specifically around A/B and multivariate testing
Desirable: Bachelor of Science (BSc) degree (math, physics, chemistry etc)
Desirable: understanding of Jupyter Notebooks, pandas, Python R or similar
Desirable: understanding of git version control
Desirable: some knowledge, understanding or experience of data science topics (machine learning knowledge a bonus)
Benefits
Enjoy delicious daily lunches of your choice delivered directly to the office, besides the fact the office is always full of snacks, fruits, drinks of all sorts and breakfast foods!
Stay in tip-top condition with health Insurance without copayment and including dental coverage
Break a sweat with a gym membership which will give you access to over 3,000 gyms, studios and classes throughout Spain, including spa access for you and a friend!
Weekly business-English classes and Spanish lessons are delivered in the office by leading teachers with the option for 1-on-1 classes where needed
In-office chair massages every Thursday by our resident massage therapist, a chance to relieve the aches and pains of your day
An annual learning budget to be used in the way you see best, ensuring you’re always growing - you’ll also benefit from regular coaching sessions hosted by your peers and industry experts
Spotify and Netflix subscriptions to make sure you’re on top of all the latest music and movies, if you prefer a different streaming service, just let us know!
You’ll be equipped with an awesome new MacBook & our branded merchandise, along with all the fixtures which complete the perfect workstation
Have access to our incredible office based in Barcelona’s WeWork - it’s full of games, chill out areas, snacks and beer on tap
Access to a global network of co-working spaces for when you’re utilising our remote days which account for more than 50% of the year!
This is of course besides the 23 days of annual leave and all the Barcelona public holidays to use when you please!

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos Holaluz y nacimos para hacer del mundo, un lugar mejor para todos. ¿Quieres saber cómo? En este vídeo te lo cuenta Carlota Pi, una de las tres fundadoras de Holaluz.
Tú y el planeta sois lo que nos mueve a ser como somos y a hacer lo que hacemos. Uno de nuestros principales valores es #AlwaysPeopleFirst. Por eso, te proponemos seguir creciendo en un entorno donde el #HaveFun y el #KeepRowing son imprescindibles, pero en el que puedas también desarrollarte 360º.

Nuestra voluntad de hacer las cosas de un modo distinto, nos ha llevado a liderar la transformación del sector eléctrico y a ser la primera eléctrica en obtener el certificado BCorp. En Holaluz:
No vendemos únicamente electricidad 100% de origen renovable, ofrecemos una relación a largo plazo con nuestros clientes basada en la confianza.
Gracias al uso de la tecnología, ofrecemos productos personalizados y tarifas que permiten ahorrar a las personas.
Convertimos los tejados en energía 100% verde.
Llevamos casi una década revolucionando el sector de la energía eléctrica. De hecho, estamos transformando los metros cuadrados de los tejados de nuestras ciudades y pueblos en energía 100% verde para todos. Y lo hemos llamado la Revolución de los Tejados.
Nuestra misión no es otra que conectar a todas las personas a la energía 100% verde y no pararemos hasta conseguirlo.
¿Te sumas?

¿Qué harás?
El foco del día a día está puesto en dar soporte a todo el equipo de ventas, por un lado creando herramientas que automaticen, agilicen y mejoren las principales tareas del equipo y por otro lado analizando en profundidad multitud de datos para convertir estos datos en información valiosa que ayude al equipo a tomar las mejores decisiones.
Estamos buscando un analista de datos que tenga una visión amplia de negocio.
Como analista estratégico tienes que combinar los conocimientos de programación con
los conocimientos de negocio para poder proporcionar las mejores soluciones de la forma más holística y rigurosa posible.
El equipo de sales data es un equipo pequeño con el que ejecutarás proyectos end-to-end, desde analizar cuáles son las posibles errores o potenciales mejoras, diseñar posibles soluciones y llevarlas a cabo programándolas. Tendrás total libertad para decidir cómo hacer las cosas de la mejor manera posible, ¡estamos deseando escuchar tus propuestas!
Tus principales responsabilidades serán:
Liderar proyectos que convierten datos en valor para Holaluz.
Creación y mantenimiento de procesos ETL para tener actualizado nuestro "Data Lake" y "Data Warehouse".
Creación de informes de BI para seguir métricas y KPI de ventas.
Dar soporte a todo el equipo de ventas con todo lo relacionado con los datos.
Construir herramientas y soluciones para hacer la vida más fácil a nuestros compañeros de equipo de ventas
Creación, optimización y mantenimiento de herramientas automatizadas (Simuladores de facturas, generadores de ofertas, etc.)
Automatizar tareas recurrentes del equipo
Pensar en nuevas fuentes de datos que contribuyan al crecimiento y la eficiencia de Holaluz.
Participar en las reuniones de pricing con los equipos de Gross Margin y Gestión de la energía.
Y como #SayThingsAsTheyAre es uno de nuestro valores, queremos ser claros y transparentes en explicarte qué harás durante tus primeros 6 meses en Holaluz.

En 1 mes...
Después del primer mes ya sabrás cómo está todo montado, te habrás empapado de nuestra cultura y tendrás una visión más clara de tus metas.
Seguramente habrás ido a comer algún viernes con las personas del equipo, habrás asistido a alguna formación del sector y alguna reunión de pricing.
Habrás solucionado algún error y habrás creado tu primer informe.
En 3 meses...

Seguro que ya habrás tomado muchas decisiones sobre cómo aportar valor a tu equipo y estarás trabajando codo a codo con tus colegas, en otras palabras, habrás visto la LUZ.
Habrás disfrutado de algún team building con el equipo y empezarás a dominar nuestras bases de datos, ¡SQL será tu segunda lengua!
En 6 meses...
Tendrás (casi) todo bajo control y habrás contribuido en la madurez y crecimiento de tu equipo de ventas. Habrás aprendido mucho y empezarás a dominar todas las herramientas.
Además, habrás tenido varias reuniones con tu responsable para saber cómo te sientes en tus primeros meses con Holaluz.

¿Cómo lo harás?
Otro de nuestros valores es #KeepRowing o seguir remando, lo que significa que el trabajo en equipo y la alineación del mismo es fundamental para poder avanzar y hacer frente a nuestros objetivos compartidos.
En Holaluz hemos construido un sistema organizativo robusto y en constante iteración, que permite adaptarnos a los cambios constantes que exige el sector y a conseguir el propósito que perseguimos, utilizando diversas metodologías, entre ellas SCRUM. En Holaluz las reuniones y decisiones se hacen de forma colaborativa, el feedback fluye entre los diferentes equipos y se promueve el apoyo entre las personas.

¿Con quién lo harás?
#AlwaysPeopleFirst y #HaveFun son también valores muy importantes en Holaluz, y para pasárselo bien es importante tener un buen equipo de trabajo, por eso te presentamos a las personas con las que trabajarás en tu día a día.
En el equipo de sales data trabajarás juntamente con Marwa, que de momento es la única integrante del equipo de datos. Pero también estarás trabajando codo a codo con Blanca que se encarga de tener controlado el Gross Margin de la compañía, con Lluc y el equipo de Sales OPS que están siempre pendientes de atender a nuestro canal comercial. También ayudarás a Karel y su equipo para seguir aumentando las ventas de nuestros canales comerciales y al equipo de Oriol con las ventas directas. Y por supuesto, también con María que dirige todo el equipo comercial.

¿Dónde lo harás?
Otra forma de #KeepRowing es remar todos juntos en perfecta sincronización y hacia un objetivo común, y qué mejor lugar para hacerlo que en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona a sólo 200 metros del mar . Esta excepcional ubicación al lado de la playa es perfecta para hacer un break con chapuzón y poder poner en práctica otro de nuestros valores #HaveFun.

Otra forma de #KeepRowing es remar todos juntos en perfecta sincronización y hacia un objetivo común, y qué mejor lugar para hacerlo que en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona a sólo 200 metros del mar . Esta excepcional ubicación al lado de la playa es perfecta para hacer un break con chapuzón y poder poner en práctica otro de nuestros valores #HaveFun. Pero desde marzo se han multiplicado por casi 200 las ofis de Holaluz, cada unx tiene su pequeña Holaluz, con sus vistas al mar (o no), su máquina de café o té, su open space para comer, sus salas de reuniones (ahora con un poco más de disponibilidad), y también sus rutinas y su organización. Apostamos por la individualidad y la flexibilidad poniendo a las personas en el centro de nuestras decisiones, es por eso que nuestras oficinas están abiertas para aquellxs que lo necesiten o les apetezca trabajar en ellas. Estamos trabajando el flexible seating en la oficina y habilitando taquillas individuales para todxs, a la vez que estamos equiparando todas las salas de reuniones para poder hacer mejores vídeo-conferencias y que sigamos trabajando lo más cómodxs posible desde casa o desde la oficina. Nuestra gente es lo más importante, por lo que en la oficina debemos de cumplir los siguientes acuerdos:
Para movernos dentro de la oficina es imprescindible llevar mascarilla. No cuando estemos sentados en nuestro sitio de trabajo (respetando las distancias) pero sí en los desplazamientos (baños, entrada y salida, ir a la cocina, duchas o salas de reuniones.)
Ahora apostamos por el ¡Choque de codos! para saludarnos
El equipo de limpieza viene a diario pero para reforzar este punto disponemos de kits limpiadores en todas las salas y otros puntos de Holaluz
Y por supuesto: distancia de seguridad, lavado de manos, aforo limitado y visitas externas restringidas
Requirements
¿Qué necesitamos?
Hemos pensado muy muy bien lo que buscamos y lo que de verdad importa:
Licenciatura en matemáticas, física, informática, ingeniería o similar.
Pensamiento analítico
Dominio de SQL
Dominio de al menos un lenguaje de programación (Pentaho o Python)
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI, Qlikview, Tableau ...)
Una persona muy adaptable a los cambios.
Alta capacidad para comprender las reglas comerciales y las necesidades del equipo.
2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos
Benefits
¿Qué ofrecemos?
Otro de los valores que nos caracteriza en Holaluz es #EsPosible. Por ello, ofrecemos una serie de medidas para que puedas desarrollarte 360º y conseguir todo aquello que te propongas, tanto a nivel personal como profesional. En consonancia con esto, pensamos que la energía más potente proviene de las personas, de manera que #AlwaysPeopleFirst forma parte de nuestro ADN, por ello, tendrás la oportunidad de:
Unirte a la primera eléctrica europea con Certificado B Corp (empresas que innovan para maximizar su impacto positivo en los empleados, la comunidad donde sirven y el medio ambiente).
Empresa certificada como Baby Friendly Company. Equal parental leave (igualando la baja paternal a la maternal). Nursery para ayudar a integrar la vida y el trabajo para los nuevos padres. “Casals” esas semanas del año en las que compaginar vacaciones de los niños y trabajo se hace un poco más complicado.
Unirte a una empresa donde las personas son lo primero, con un entorno de trabajo inmejorable y gran talento en donde vivimos nuestros valores.
Desarrollo profesional sin límites en una empresa apasionante y un equipo con desafíos constantes.
Nuestra propia biblioteca, con contenido muy diverso.
Ser parte de una empresa orientada a objetivos y orientada a resultados. Aplicamos metodologías ágiles y la filosofía de escalamiento a todo lo que hacemos
Clases de inglés y catalán en la oficina.
Horario flexible y posibilidad de trabajo a distancia de forma habitual, como resultado de nuestra mentalidad pro responsabilidad y autonomía, y apostando por la autogestión del tiempo del equipo.
Suscripción con cuota muy reducida en Andjoy, que incluye clases de yoga y crossfit en la oficina. Mens sana in corpore sano.
Suscripción con cuota muy reducida de mutua médica.
Sistema de retribución flexible en guardería, transporte, seguro de salud y comida con Cobee.
Referral bonus, si traes a gente con tanto talento como tú.
Fruta ecológica cada día.
La oportunidad de contribuir al crecimiento de una empresa que quiere cambiar el mundo.
Plan de retribución en acciones.
Tarifa competitiva de movilidad sostenible con eCooltra for Holaluz. Son bicis y motos eléctricas, para poder llegar a la oficina de forma ágil y económica, en un transporte individual y ecológico.
Tarifa competitiva de Wifi con Unique.
Consultoría para crear/mejorar nuestro home office con la arquitecta de nuestras oficinas.
”Celebramos la diversidad en el mundo y queremos que nuestro equipo refleje esto de manera inclusiva. En Holaluz, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente de la raza, religión, sexo, origen nacional, orientación sexual, edad, estado civil, discapacidad, género, identidad o expresión de género. Además, nos esforzamos por empoderar a las mujeres en el lugar de trabajo.”

Description - External
Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.
En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.
Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.
Algunas de tus responsabilidades:
Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data
Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares
Participación en proyectos para grandes clientes
¿Te unes al Big Data | Accenture Technology team? ¡Aplica online!
#BigDataNinja

Requisitos:
Titulación técnica: Informática u otras con experiencia equivalente (Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física, otras ingenierías, etc.)
+2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.)
Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.)
Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)
Valorable:
Experiencia en AWS o Azure
Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.)
Experiencia en proyectos para grandes clientes

Accenture ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

About Glovo:
We're a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.
Your work-life opportunity:
We are a product centred company and all of our teams rely heavily on data to drive product development. By experimenting with features in different markets, testing hypotheses and UI/UX changes through A/B testing and tracking success metrics continuously, the Product Analytics team is strategic for the development cycle of our apps in Glovo.
As a Data Analyst in the Product team you will be responsible for using data to uncover usage and behavioral patterns and provide actionable insights that guide product development teams. We are looking for a product savvy analytics professional with the same passion that we have for using data as the main driver of product innovation and business growth.
Be a part of a team where you will:
Work closely with product managers and development teams to define, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Design and analyze product experiments (A/B tests, multivariate test, etc) that will directly impact the backlog.
Translate product questions and hypothesis into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and dashboards.
Align with engineering teams to ensure data availability/quality of new features and data sources.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology and the business.
You have:
2-4 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role: product preferred
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies.
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Experience our Glovo Life benefits:
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Spanish lessons
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment
What you'll find when working at Glovo:
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we're currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.
For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

External Job Description
Role Overview
The Information Management (IM) Business Analyst position ensures successful project delivery by designing and delivering, in close relationship with architects and technical developers, end-to-end Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Warehousing solutions for IQVIA Clients.
Responsibilities
As Information Management and PMI Business Analyst, you will:
Be accountable for the overall writing of business requirements, analysis of Client data as key inputs to the design of technical MDM and CDW solutions
As a business analyst, you will ensure this analysis is done with an end-to-end business process perspective in mind – most of the time this will consists in the analysis of data across Data sources (One Key among others) – MDM – CRMxx, or, for the “pre-commercial” domain, the analysis of Clinical, R&D, pharmacovigilance data source that will feed a product MDM solution
Produce “data architectures”; you will analyze the data (profile the data), determine key business rules, and devise target data architectures
Ensure that business and functional conditions are in place for a successful delivery of the MDM / CDW solution; more specifically, you will assess Client readiness from a business perspective; if needed, you will provide recommendations and plans to address “non readiness” issues
Work hand-in-hand with delivery managers to ensure escalations (from Clients or internal from RBU/Country stakeholders) are addressed adequately; the Integrated Business analyst to address business and data issues and propose adequate solution in coordination with the technical lead, and architect in the projects
Engage with customers on regular basis (project kick-off, project meetings, workshops with business stakeholders)
Within a project, functionally advise the technical delivery team (onshore, nearshore and/or offshore) as per needs
As a Business analyst, work closely with additional teams contributing to the delivery of Information Management solutions, including PMO, offshore technical delivery centers and service management.
Work closely with the Information Management product team, to get full knowledge and understand the IM products (MDM and CDW); provide feedback to the product roadmap, anticipate impact on the assigned IM projects.
Work closely with RBU Information Management leaders to understand IM forecast and regional specifics
Participate in the business development process for IM opportunities as needed
Coordinate with the One Key team and maintain a close business relationship
Coordinate and establish a relationship with other delivery teams (OCE, Compliance, PMI) as per IM project needs
Skills & Experience
6+ years' experience managing Information Management project implementation
Strong MDM and Data Management functional and business skills
Abilitity to deliver “data architectures” – starting from data profiling / analysis, defining business rules, define target data models
Ability to work with project teams geographically dispersed

Si eres matemático, ingeniero o físico, quieres trabajar en el sector IT con clientes internacionales y te gustan los retos intelectuales, ¡inscríbete en nuestra oferta!
Somos Goal Systems, una empresa española referente a nivel internacional especialista en el desarrollo de sistemas informáticos para la optimización y planificación de recursos del sector transporte, con oficinas en Madrid, París, Bogotá, Santiago de Chile, Rio de Janeiro y Ciudad de México.
Nuestro software se basa en tecnología vanguardista, desarrollado por el mejor equipo de profesionales, movidos por la búsqueda de la excelencia, el crecimiento profesional y la continua motivación por los retos.
Desde Goal Systems, apostamos por las relaciones de confianza y compromiso. Nuestro constante desarrollo de negocio nos impulsa a nuevas contrataciones de personal de distintos perfiles, buscamos profesionales de dilatada experiencia y a aquellos que quieran comenzar su carrera profesional con nosotros.
Ámbito de actuación:
El puesto de esta vacante se enmarca en el Departamento de Consultoría encargado del despliegue de los productos desarrollados por GOAL SYSTEMS en nuestros clientes de carácter internacional. Dentro del ciclo de vida de un proyecto, el Departamento de Consultoría participa principalmente en la fase de implantación, ayudando al cliente a poner en producción nuestros sistemas expertos de optimización. Para ello proporcionamos servicios de análisis de negocio, consultoría de optimización, formación y acompañamiento durante el go live.

Tus funciones:
Recopilación, análisis de negocio y seguimiento de las necesidades de los clientes.
Redacción de las especificaciones funcionales y técnicas.
Análisis y desarrollo para la incorporación de técnicas de Machine Learning y Data Mining en nuestro software.
Puesta en producción de nuestros sistemas expertos de optimización.

Tu perfil:
Se precisa carrera científica: ingeniería superior, técnica o grado, tales como matemáticas, informática, telecomunicaciones, camino, canales y puertos, obras públicas, civil, industriales, aeronáuticas y afines.
Abstenerse carreras no científicas (ADE, Económicas, Marketing…).
Formación y experiencia en Data Mining y en Machine Learning.
Conocimiento de programación en Python.
Conocimiento de optimización e investigación operativa.
Pensamiento analítico.
Dominio de una de estas lenguas: francés / inglés / portugués / italiano.

Markem-Imaje is looking for a specialist in Data Analysis with extensive experience in collecting, transforming and analyzing data as well as communicating findings across the organization. This role will specifically be focused on Data Analytics and statistical analysis related to Product, Service, Process quality and performance and will be influential in improving those. This position is reporting directly to the Global Quality Shared Services Manager

What you will do:
You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes. Your main responsibilities will include:
Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.

What you need to have:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role including experience as Data analyst.
Bachelor’s degree in business, Science or Engineering/University degree in Data Analysis.
Mastering programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
Fluent in written and spoken English.
Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
SAP CS/SD/MM and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.
Independent, quick learner with a very structured approach.

The Institute
The Centro Nacional de Análisis Genómico (CNAG-CRG) is one of the largest Genome Sequencing Centers in Europe. CNAG-CRG researchers participate in major International Genomic Initiatives such as the International Cancer Genome Consortium (ICGC), the International Human Epigenome Consortium (IHEC), the International Rare Diseases Research Consortium (IRDiRC) and the European Infrastructure for life-science information (ELIXIR), as well as in several EU-funded projects.
It is integrated with the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG), an international biomedical research institute of excellence, based in Barcelona, Spain, with more than 400 scientists from 44 countries. The CRG is composed by an interdisciplinary, motivated and creative scientific team which is supported both by a flexible and efficient administration and by high-end and innovative technologies.

In April 2021, the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG) received the renewal of the 'HR Excellence in Research' logo from the European Commission. This is a recognition of the Institute's commitment to developing an HR Strategy for Researchers, designed to bring the practices and procedures in line with the principles of the European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers (Charter and Code).
Please, check out our Recruitment Policy
The role
We are looking for a candidate who will work on the analysis of methylation using ONT long reads. This includes the benchmarking of software written in-house, the search for suitable publicly available data bases and the processing of data generated internally at CNAG and writing code to make all the analyses reproducible.
The successful candidate is expected to produce clear reports of all the findings and high-quality documentation of the pipelines involved.
About the team
The Statistical Genomics team works, among the other things, on methods for analyzing epigenetic
data from a variety of data sources and sequencing methods.
Whom would we like to hire?
Professional experience
Must Have
You have some experience with Linux shell programming
You have experience with writing R/Python code
Desirable but not required/ Nice to have
You have experience with standard bioinformatic tools for genome analysis (samtools, etc...)
Education and training
You hold a degree in Biology/Bioinformatics/computer science or comparable experience
Languages
You are proficient in English
Competences
You have highly developed organization skills
You have highly developed attention to detail
You have good communication skills

Quantitative Risk Analyst
100% | Madrid
Bring along your knowledge, your enthusiasm and your dedication and take charge as Quantitative Risk Analyst at Axpo. The energy industry is changing; it is continuing to develop dynamically and innovatively. In this role, you will take on responsibility from day one, having the opportunity to communicate and interact with personnel at all levels and across multiple business units/organizations.
What you will do
Ensures completeness and accuracy of data in the ETRM application
Produces, develops and monitors adequate Middle Office control framework for Axpo Iberia activities
Contributes to market and credit risk projects from Axpo Iberia point of view
Reports and controls risk parameters (prices, volatilities, correlations) of trading
Assists the Risk Manager to define and review further development activities of Power and Gas Division
Supports the Risk Manager in applying proper methodology and instruments to approach and analyze business products
Supports the Risk Manager in assessing risk indicators, analysing potential scenarios and reporting risks
In connection with the head quarter, operation, maintenance and stability of the ETRM Platform from both a functional and a technical perspective
Assists the Risk Manager to solve production issues encountered by the business Testing, validation and installation of new application releases.

What you bring & who you are
University degree with background in quantitative finance or an equivalent diploma such as Mathematics, Statistics etc. One of the following would be an additional asset: FRM/ERP, CQF, CFA, Master in Finance ETH or similar
Minimum of five years of experience as quant in a trading environment and/or risk management
In depth knowledge in pricing and valuation of complex and structured products
Strong understanding of quantitative methods for market and credit measurement and managements
In depth understanding of financial and commodity markets in particular in the area of gas
Programming skills for prototyping and ad hoc solutions
Ability to absorb new concepts quickly and solve problems efficiently
Fluent in English
What we offer
Fit for the future
We're among the best in power trading. Be part of Axpo's market success and actively help shape the sector as it transforms. Join us as we create customised solutions as a niche player in the area of origination. At the same time you can develop your own skills, tackle exciting challenges and take on responsibility.
Can-do culture
At Axpo, your contribution counts, so get involved! We embrace agile innovation processes and use a collaboration platform for informal exchange. The start-up vibe makes it easy to share your ideas and make things happen. Who knows? Maybe you'll be involved in our next Axpo Group spin-off.
The whole package
As a market leader in our field, we're proud to offer competitive salaries across Axpo. That includes a commitment to fair pay. Performance-related compensation components enable us to recognise and reward excellence at every level of the organisation.
Lifelong learning
The Axpo Academy offers a catalogue of courses, training and certification programs. We contribute time and financial support to help you develop your technical expertise, soft skills and language proficiency.
Health first
Axpo contributes 90% of your local gym membership fee and covers your health and life insurance premiums.
Happy birthday
Enjoy your special day and leave work at lunchtime. This extra half-day is in addition to your regular 23 days of annual leave.
About us
Axpo Iberia, a subsidiary of the Axpo Group, was established in Spain in 2002 and manages the most important independent portfolio of renewable energies on the Iberian Peninsula. We offer our customers in Spain and Portugal products and services in the fields of energy and gas supply, energy management for producers of renewable energies and heat and power cogeneration, as well as trading of raw materials, biomass and CO2. Axpo is Switzerland's largest producer of renewable energy, as well as an international leader in energy trading and the marketing of solar and wind power. At its headquarters in Switzerland and in 30 countries across Europe as well as the US, around 5,000 employees use state-of-the-art technology to develop sustainable, innovative energy solutions.
More information
About the team
Our team think and work in an interdisciplinary way and are closely connected at national and international level. We offer a young, open and collaborative work atmosphere in a professional and innovative environment.
We are looking for people who are a reliable, customer-oriented and entrepreneurial minded person who enjoys taking on responsibility and would like to play an active part in the success of Axpo.

Power BI, Business Intelligence

Description
Analyze the macro market and internal business factors to strategically price products to maximize revenue and/or profit. This role would be responsible for business planning and attainment which will require working cross-functionally between Sales, Finance and Product Owners. Utilizes reports of findings and creates appropriate materials to communicate the findings. He or she will maintain a broad understanding of Ingram Micro’s business model along with becoming educated on particular vendors, customers, and internal division’s business models and needs.
As a Pricing Consultant II, the focus will be to define pricing issues and identify how pricing facts, data and decisions link to overall business strategy issues. Leverage B2B pricing experience to lead clients through sales improvements through Pricing. Act as a thought leader, providing practical recommendations and contributing to team discussions on implications of analysis; identifying implementation challenges. Predict emerging customer needs and develop innovative solutions to meet them. Champion and support new projects communicating its value and engage others to participate. Candidate is expected to handle large data sets, consolidating and transforming data for analysis.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
A Analysis and Reporting: % of Time is 30%. Pull data from multiple sources. Understand client’s data objectives and translate business need into the appropriate technical data model. Run data models and review data output to ensure the model is accurate along with translating the trends and output of the data model. Be familiar with and use consistently at least two of the following modeling techniques:
Linear/logistic regression, Clustering, Decision and model Trees
ANOVA Model
Price optimization, price elasticity/demand modeling
B Communication: % of Time is 50%. Effectively listen, communicate, recommend, and present data analytic solutions to internal and external clients. This includes over the phone and in person presentations with PowerPoint and other media sources.
C Program Organization and Execution: % of Time is 20%. Work closely with the project manager to communicate project eta, status, modeling outputs, and client communication needs.
III. JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Formal education or training required such as degrees, courses of study, certification: Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in a quantitative field such as: Statistics, Operations Research, Econometrics or Applied Mathematics
MS degree with at least 3 years experience of consulting experience in pricing or pricing consulting
Understand client’s objectives and translate business need into the pricing strategies. Knowledge of basic statistics such as standard deviation, mean. Awareness of Machine learning and data mining and the ability to speak to its uses
Experience in analyzing large data sets, identifying trends and patterns preferred.
Synthesize findings, develop recommendations and communicate results to clients and internal teams
Experience with cleaning, aggregating, and pre-processing data from varied sources.
Intermediate experience using SQL queries for standard as well as ad hoc data mining purposes. With specializations in at least one of the following; database design, architecture and/or data integration.
Ability to communicate a clear and persuasive argument to high level Executives around Pricing Strategy and Operations
Ability to independently lead and own projects on cross functional teams.
Subject matter expertise in at least 2 of the following: price optimization, price elasticity and customer segmentation.
OTHER SKILLS AND COMPETENCES:
Implement own recommendations and see projects through to completion.
Analyze current methods and procedures, recommend and implement improvements.
Mathematical ability sufficient to add, subtract, multiple, divide, figure averages.
Ability to communicate effectively by telephone and in group meetings and discussions. Ability to give and receive information accurately.
Ability to follow directions and procedures accurately; to organize facts and figures; apply basic arithmetic.
Participate in meetings to give and receive information several times a month.
Conduct meetings or presentations to explain, negotiate or persuade.

IQVIA - the Human Data Science Company - is grounded in three interconnected forces: human data, human science, and data science. IQVIA contributes to the advancement of human health globally through timely research, insightful analysis and scientific expertise applied to granular non-identified patient-level data.
The IQVIA Real-World Solutions (RWS) team works with clients worldwide to support their use of complex, clinically rich, patient-level healthcare datasets to answer specific research questions and make informed decisions. We are a collaborative, intellectually curious, entrepreneurial and innovative group looking to harness the value of Real-World Evidence (RWE) in a constantly evolving industry.
Specifically, you will be working in the RWS Emerging Methods & Solutions (EMS) Development Team. The team is responsible for advancing the IQVIA capabilities as part of the EMS Portfolio. This includes oversight of EMS RWE Study delivery, driving targeted internal capability development, client business development, and operational study delivery. EMS Studies enrich data by integrating two methods of data collection (primary and secondary) to build a comprehensive longitudinal patient record, increasing both the availability and depth of researchable data. The group are innovative in their use of secondary data (e.g. electronic medical records, health claims) and seek to provide tangible benefits to our clients through this methodology.
Role
As an Analyst you will join a high profile, talented and fast paced team, actively participating in the development and delivery of the EMS Portfolio. You must thrive in a collaborative environment where you can leverage the globally extensive assets of IQVIA to support the team to accelerate new business growth, build in-depth expertise in innovative observational research and learn approaches to data management. You will provide high quality, time-sensitive input to both client projects and internally funded capability development projects. Assignments range in complexity from basic analysis and problem solving to assisting in the development of complex solutions across multiple geographies and business units. Tasks will require technical, process-driven and scientific know-how, working with global and functionally diverse teams. The successful candidate will benefit from professional development and learning opportunities, which includes skill-specific training courses and on-the-job training.
Principal Accountabilities
As an Analyst you will be working on development workstreams and client projects within multidisciplinary and international teams. Your responsibilities will include:
Development workstream responsibilities and skills:
Flexibility in assignment to multiple workstreams and client studies.
Will work with team members in different geographies and/or different functional responsibilities and expertise (i.e. observational research design and study operations).
Engage with external parties to understand and assess novel technologies, the competitive landscape, and research methodologies.
Work closely with senior business and scientific leaders to create innovative solutions for the EMS Team.
Proactively develop a basic knowledge of consulting methodologies, observational research, and the life sciences market through the delivery of engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunities.
Develop broad knowledge of healthcare technologies, real-world sources, and research methodologies necessary to execute development projects.
Acquire deep knowledge of IQVIA data sources and the broader RWS landscape.
Seek out and build a network of colleagues within the IQVIA organisation to share and obtain relevant information required to progress EMS workstreams.
Client engagement responsibilities and skills:
Perform quantitative and qualitative analyses under supervision to assist in the identification of client issues and the development of client specific solutions.
Contribute to the preparation, execution and follow up of client meetings and workshops.
Conduct independent desk research to specific briefs using internal and external sources.
Create sections of reports, presentations and other client deliverables, under supervision.
Support the development of proposals.
Desired Skills and Experience
Candidates interested in joining as an Analyst will have:
Understanding of and interest in the international healthcare environment.
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills (additional language is an advantage) including presentations, chairing meetings, workshop facilitation, business and report writing.
Support strategic decision making on study designs.
Proven ability to advance ambiguous or conceptual ideas into tangible and practical plans as part of offering and development.
Competent in using Word and PowerPoint and developing clear storylines.
Strong commitment to high quality work and an interest in rapid learning and skill development.
Ability to take direction from senior team members and deliver high quality output.
Ability to conduct independent research and information gathering.
Qualifications
In addition to the skills and experience above, candidates interested in joining as an Analyst will have:
Undergraduate degree with a strong academic track record in life sciences, economics/business/mathematics/statistics, and/or experience in the health care industry.
A postgraduate qualification in life sciences discipline is desirable although not essential.
Relevant internship or work experience is desirable.

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

Role/Responsibilities
The Role
The Associate Analyst 3 (AA3) will conduct comprehensive analysis on an assigned portfolio of ratings/credits. The AA3 will perform holistic evaluations of credit risk by integrating credit inputs prepared by others, including Financial Data Analysts (FDAs), RRS Associates and external parties. In conducting credit analysis for their assigned portfolios, transactions or credit reviews, AA3s will actively participate in rating committee discussions and interact with issuers and other market participants, in collaboration with Lead Analysts.
As an Associate Analyst 3 you will:
Join Moody’s Corporate Finance ratings lines of business (LOB)
Receive analytical and professional onboarding plus on-going training, with a potential to selective cross-training in different asset classes or sectors.
Support senior lead analysts with financial modeling and preparation of rating committees, publications such as press releases, credit opinions, research and investor outreach materials.
Interact with bond issuers and arrangers and present your analysis in credit committees
Work on global or cross LOB projects, as opportunities arise.
Be mentored by senior lead analysts to further develop your analytical skills.
A dedicated Associate Analysts team manager (AATM) will support and track progress on your career development goals, by providing timely coaching and career guidance.

Key Responsibilities
Portfolio Management
Performs day-to-day credit analysis related to ratings, research, presentations, and investor outreach. Examples of analytical work produced include:
Reviewing financial spreadsheets and charts prepared by others, analyzing data and financial statements, building and updating financial forecasts, and writing analytical commentary in accordance with Moody’s methodologies.
Assisting with proprietary models and new financial projections as applicable, identifying trends in data, and applying analytical skills and judgment to form well-reasoned credit conclusions.
Reviewing transaction documents and building knowledge of cash flow and loss allocation rules (if applicable to LOB).
Prepares first draft of rating committee memos
Interprets and analyzes financial data and other credit inputs provided by others e.g. FDAs and RRS Associates.
Monitors credit quality and issuer and/or portfolio trends by following market developments, analyzing issuer reporting, and engaging with issuers directly for follow-up clarification and information.
Attends rating committee meetings
Research & Investor Outreach
Prepares first draft of core research as applicable to the LOB e.g. credit opinions, issuer and sector comments, press releases, pre sale and new issue reports etc.
Attends investor briefings and issuer meetings as required;
Credit Administration
Performs analytical tasks related to portfolio reviews and other credit projects (e.g. liquidity scrubs).
Operates applicable ratings and research systems and utilizes software specific to the rating group. Identifies all issues with data for follow up with Lead Analyst.
Coaching & Guidance
Provides feedback to AATM on the quality and accuracy of work produced by FDA’s, along with providing constructive and proactive feedback to collegues and FDAs.
Qualifications

An AA3 employee joining Moody.s will typically be a final year BSc and MSc student or a recent graduate with up to 3 years work experience
Accounting background with strong focus in financial analysis (e.g., through coursework, CFA or equivalent, or relevant work experience).
Good to advanced working knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Solid verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly
Fluency in English & Spanish is required and professional proficiency in another European languages is highly desired
LOB/Cost Center
The Ratings & Research Support department is responsible for producing analytical inputs in support of Moody’s Ratings and Research function. In addition, this department will provide support for surveillance requirements and partner with R&R to provide the necessary support for issuer and investor interactions.

About us

Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us


"Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer"

Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

The Position:
Cigna, a leading global health services provider, is going through an exciting period of expansion and we are looking to recruit a Business Analyst. This person will be a key member of the Total Health and Network team and will be based in Madrid.

The role is required to support a number of network, health and wellbeing initiatives within the Total Health and Network team, supporting our global team of clinicians, network and wellbeing experts and working with IT Infrastructure, Applications, Web, Systems Admin, database administrators, Technical 3rd parties and other key areas of Cigna’s organization.

The role will act as the designated Business Analyst for various Cigna global health and network based projects and involve building successful relationships across the business, across all levels, and map the current “as is” technical and business processes and then use these outputs to create the “to be” processes for the organisation.

In addition, the Business Analyst will be required to assist in the preparation and implementation of the project, documenting the Technical and Functional Specifications and Requirements documentation that can be used by the software development, IT Infrastructure, system and application architecture and Web Teams to enable Cigna to develop and deliver key projects, and work cohesively with the project managers and product owners to ensure adherence to project practices and principals.

The role reports directly to the Total Health and Network PMO Lead based in Madrid. The successful candidate will be a high-performing individual who is methodical, inquisitive and has a passion for delivering high quality, on time results.

Main Duties / Responsibilities :
The suitable candidate must be able to demonstrate strong experience in the following areas:
Business Analysis techniques such as Use Case completion, process modelling, root cause analysis, data models, process maps and traceability management
Lead requirements and specifications workshops and facilitate effective discussion
Gather and document Business & Functional Specifications to meet business requirements and Prepare and review full BA lifecycle documentation
Document workflows and results of business analysis into the business requirements for the project
Support technical teams in the development of estimations and plans for the delivery of business requirements by ensuring clarity in business/functional requirements
Ability to follow and contribute to the maintenance of the PMO Framework and BA Standards of Practice
Ability to use available technology in the most efficient manner to allow business goals to be achieved

Experience Required:
Experience as Business Analyst or applications architect.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience in the production of Technical and Functional design.
Experience in gathering and in managing the production of Technical and Functional Specifications against Business Requirements.
Salesforce knowledge highly desirable
Experience in Agile methodologies desirable
Knowledge gained within the Insurance or Health Industry desirable.
Experience working with virtual teams based globally desirable.

Education/Professional Qualifications Required:
Degree qualified.
ECBA, CBAP, CCBA, PMI-PBA, CPRE or equivalent business analysis qualification is desirable.
Scrum or SAFe certification is desirable.

Skills:
Problem Solving
Collaborative approach to working towards results with Customer Focus
Dealing with Ambiguity
Learning & Applying Quickly
Perspective
Highly organized approach
Good team communication skills (written and verbal), confident in dealing with internal and external clients
Technology savvy

About Cigna
Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives. What difference will you make?
