Our client is a global designer, developer and manufacturer of market-leading medical aesthetic device technologies. The business is going through significant and rapid growth across the globe. As part of their development, they are now looking for a Global IT Security Analyst to join their team in Europe.
The candidates can be based anywhere in Europe, preferably in Spain.
The Global IT Security Analyst is responsible for planning and implementing security measures to protect computer systems, networks and data as well as handling the IT operations according to the IT Service Level Agreement keeping the Support Model aligned with Corporate Strategy. Day-to-day work will involve staying up-to-date on the latest security technologies in order to anticipate security breaches and preventing data loss and service interruptions. The position reports to IT Global Security and Compliance Lead (Director level).
Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate on execute and establishes system controls by developing a framework for controls and levels of access, recommending improvements for the global IT environment.
Supervise applications and systems security by providing information, resources, and technical support to all company assets.
Establishes computer and terminal physical security collaborating on developing standards, policies, and procedures; coordinating with all IT areas; recommending improvements. Work on Software Quality practices, Disaster Recovery Plan and Business Continuity Plan
Ensures authorized access by investigating improper access; revoking access; reporting violations; monitoring information requests by new programming; recommending improvements.
Develops security awareness by providing orientation, educational programs, and ongoing communication.
Requirements:
Relevant university degree in information technology, computer science or relevant
Experience in networking, routing and switching, backup and recovery, firewalls, VPN’s remote implementation, troubleshooting
Experience in IT compliance assessments, IT security controls, Gap analysis, IT governance and service strategy.
Ability to troubleshoot and repair issues, root cause analysis and problem-solving
Experience in Project management.
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Hands-on and proactive person, flexible and ability to manage critical situations
Excellent English, Spanish and Portuguese are advantages
The candidates can be based in Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Seville, Bilbao, Málaga, Oviedo–Gijón–Avilés, Alicante-Elche or anywhere else in Spain.

Advantio is a leading Cyber Security and Managed Security Services (MSS) provider that helps businesses fight Cybercrime, protect data and reduce security risk. Offering a comprehensive portfolio of Cyber Security Advisory & Testing Services, Managed Security Services, Technology Solutions and Cyber Security Education, Advantio is the security partner of choice for many large corporate enterprises globally covering a wide range of industries including but not limited to banking, insurance, gambling, travel, retail, telco, oil & gas and public sector bodies. Advantio primarily serves the Payment Card Industry and when it comes to payment transactions, has been recognised by VISA as one of Europe’s top Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) providers.

For more information about Advantio, visit https://www.advantio.com

Role

Due to our continued expansion we now have an immediate opening for a Security Consultant in Madrid and Barcelona.
Mission: to lead Cyber Security Consultancy engagements with clients and customer within financial services and payment card industries. Focusing on delivery of PCI DSS and/or PA-DSS Information Security compliance assessments, Cyber Security Maturity Assessments and ISO27001 engagements.

Responsibilities

Main:
Lead customer engagements and provide senior cyber security advice and services to a broad range of clients and industries.
Provide detailed analytical reporting, internal reporting metrics and program management.
Provide leadership and mentorship to Junior consultants.

Preliminary Analysis:
Identifying all the stakeholders, sponsors, technical references (e.g. IT Project Manager, Software Engineer, Security Analyst) of the client in order to define the initial conditions and the needs analysis

Gap Analysis and Scoping
Review and validation of the PCI DSS scope and network segmentation controls, payment application design and functionality
Review of all locations and flows of cardholder data, as well as asset inventories
Conducting PCI standards interviews to have a complete map of information/data workflows, processes and procedures, payment card data flow, information security controls
Conducting technical interviews to understand eventual data security problems from in-depth technical point of view
Producing Scoping and Gap Analysis Documentation

Remediation
Providing the customer with a remediation plan/gap report
Guiding and supporting all the remediation processes ensuring that the gaps are mitigated correctly

Formal Assessment
Conducting PCI DSS/PA-DSS related interviews with responsible employees in order to have a complete map of information/data workflows, processes and procedures, payment card data flows, application design and functionality
Conducting technical interviews to understand eventual data security problems from in-depth technical point of view
Analysis of network diagrams, asset lists to understand the infrastructure used by the customers
Analysis of Penetration Testing reports (PCI DSS Compliance Process) and/or performance of applications penetration tests and forensic analysis (PA-DSS Compliance Process) within ad-hoc penetration testing laboratories

Documentation
Preparation, validation and approval Reports on Compliance (RoC) and/or Reports of Validation (RoV) according to the standard templates provided by PCI SSC
Preparation, validation and approval of Attestation of Compliance (AoC) and/or Attestation of Validation (AoV) according to the standard templates provided by PCI SSC
Submission all the documentation to PCI SSC for the final approval in case of PA-DSS process (signed RoV, AoV, Implementation Guide and Vendor Release Agreement)

Knowledge and Skills (Security Consultant)

Information Security Experience
PCI DSS (PA-DSS, P2PE, PCI 3DS), GDPR
Virtualization
Cloud technologies
Authentication methods and techniques
Integrity controls
Networking
Operating Systems (Linux/Unix, Windows)

Values and Competencies

Problem Solving (analysis, helicopter view, problem setting, decision making)
Planning and Organization (time management, scheduling and control)
Communication (clearness, listening, persuasion)
Networking (reinforce relationships, use emotional intelligence and personal proximity)
Results Orientation (delivering solutions, work under pressures

Advantio Core Values

Harmony, always strive to create harmony
Openness, always be open
Social Responsibility, be socially responsible
Timeless, whatever you build make it timeless
Accommodating, make our customers feel at Home
Learning, be a Learn it all q Deliver, Results

Do you crave the creativity and freedom of a startup but the stability of a large, established company?
Are you seeking the autonomy to take risks, make decisions and drive business success? Do you want to accelerate your career to the next level?
By joining to the team of our partner, you’ll be playing a significant role! Having an opportunity to make an immediate impact on the business. Their entrepreneurial scope means they operate with the agility of a high growth start-up, but with the confidence & backing of a Fortune 100 corporation.

What we ask for:
MS or PhD in a quantitative field (Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathmathics…)
More than three years of experience in the pricing consulting field.
Experience with large sets of data, and identifying trends and prefered patterns.
Communication skills, as you’ll work with cross functional teams and high leve executives
SQL experience
Experience cleaning, aggregating and processing data from vairous sources.
Experience (or willingness to) develop and lead new projects
You master at least two of the following: Price optimization, Price elasticity and costumer segmentation

What you will do:
Analize and report (about 30% of your time)
Comunicate (about 50% of your time)
Organize and execute the Project (about 20% of your time)

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.
In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.
In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Job Description

OVERALL OBJECTIVES:
The Security Risk Analyst is in charge of analyzing the general security posture of Eurofins Food & Environment in Europe, by assessing the new projects and analysing exceptions and risk acceptance requests.

SPECIFIC ASSIGNMENTS:
The Security Risk Analyst is in charge of managing the BaU security activities within Food&Environment Europe, among which:
Risk analysis of major business or IT projects
Security instruction of architecture approval approval
Security instruction of high-risk projects (exposed to the internet, dealing with sensitive data, or externalized)
Redaction of Risk acceptances / risk exceptions and monthly follow-up
Support of the labs and ZISOs on security reviews:
Support during security audits, including for the remediations of findings
Support of the entities to gather information for renewal of security certification such as ISO27k
Early security assessment of newly acquired companies
Third-party security monitoring:
Yearly security assessment of our major providers that handle data for the entities of Eurofins F&E EU, such as cloud providers or externalized material activities (process to be defined)
Answer to request of information from clients on cybersecurity
Security reporting and yearly maturity assessment of the zones
Contribute to the quarterly security dashboard, to monitor the evolution of security KPI (such as patching level, number of exceptions, number of security incidents …)
Security expertise for F&E entities on Group Security projects
Rating of the compliance to the security policy for each zone, to measure progress and to identify as early as possible major deviations

Qualifications

Technical Skills:
Excellent general culture in cybersecurity, with an expertise in at least one security topic such as Authentication, IAM, Application Security
A knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks is a must (NIST CSF, CIS20, ISO27k)
A certification (for senior position) is a huge plus:
Preferred: CISM, CISSP, ISO27k lead implementor
Nice to have: CISA, CEH, or other very technical security certifications
Good organizational skills, able to work on multiple topics in parallel
Proficiency with office tools such as excel, powerpoint and sharepoint
Capacity to work under minimal supervision
Good level of energy
Education and/or Experience:
Master degree in IT or in CyberSecurity
Experience: 5-10 years for senior, 0-2 years for junior
Fluent in English, a second European language (French, German, Polish) highly appreciated

Additional Information

APPLICATION
As the role and Eurofins IT Talent Acquisition team are international, please ensure to send your application in English.

Barcelona, Spain
Full-time

Job Title: Associate Project Manager - People Operations Quality (They/She/He)
Job Description:
About Glovo:
We're a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you'll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your work-life opportunity:
Aim to improve the performance of thousands of Partners who use Glovo, globally. The individual will collaborate with teams operating in Glovo markets to collect insights and provide inputs for projects focused on partner performance and retraining. The responsibilities include:
Be a part of a team where you will:
Give you the trust and support to grow, develop, and make a difference while encouraging you to bring your unique perspective to the table
Collaborate together and learn from each other
Be an expert on all projects and developments on improving Partner performance
Define the right metrics, build and provide tools to help regional and country Partner Operations teams to drive improvements
Work closely with analysts to build relevant dashboards and measures
Willing to learn and iterate quickly to find winning solutions
Be proactive and comfortable to adopt a hands on approach and execute when essential
Use a data driven approach to decision making
Proactive and positive to identify opportunities and work on them with minimal management oversight
You have:
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude
A passion to make a positive impact on the life of millions of people through technology
1-2 years of experience in operations or managing projects
Proven track record of process improvement
Proven experience improving performance and making data driven decisions
Demonstrated data analysis experience and high proficiency with Excel is a must, good knowledge of SQL
Worked in a fast-paced environment and enjoy providing insights that will help evolve existing project and define new ones
Highly motivated and results-driven
A high level of proficiency in English
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience our Glovo Life benefits:
Enticing equity plan
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
External learning budget
What you'll find when working at Glovo:
Gas: We work with energy, innovation and passion for what we do. We are committed.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone regardless of gender, sexual orientation, religion, and abilities.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

Job Description and Qualifications
Air Products is a thriving Fortune 500 global company that is growing and looking for talented, driven Digital Technology professionals to join our team! With over 19,000 employees and operations in over 50 countries, Air Products is committed to its Higher Purpose of bringing people together to collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges.

We are excited to share that our Data Privacy team is expanding to meet privacy compliance requirements across the world. We’re making a significant investment in our people and systems to strengthen our privacy foundation and optimize our data privacy program. If you are passionate about achieving these goals as well, we would like you to consider joining our team!

We have an immediate opening for a Senior Privacy Analyst. This position can be located at our new company headquarters in Allentown, PA or can be available to those working remotely in the US. In the case of remote work, physical presence in the office may be required on occasion to engage in face-to-face collaboration among teammates.

What you’ll do:
Participate in the execution and ongoing improvement of the privacy program
Coordinate projects and initiatives to ensure compliance with privacy regulations in each country where we operate
Develop operational privacy metrics that have value to the organization to increase effectiveness and efficiency of the program
Develop and maintain privacy policies and procedures
Collaborate and work closely with business areas to prioritize work and deliver on project commitments related to privacy
Support the investigation and resolution of privacy incidents
Plan and lead cross-functional meetings
Continuously improve Air Products overall privacy posture
What we’re looking for:
Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Information Systems, Human Resources, or equivalent work experience
3 – 5 years professional experience, ideally focused on privacy and/or security compliance
Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or equivalent privacy certification is highly desired
Passion to learn about data privacy
Experience working with global teams
Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications
Bi-lingual skills would be desirable

Continue building your technical career by applying today at Air Products.

In addition to offering a comprehensive benefits package including holidays/vacation, medical, dental, life insurance and retirement plans, we also pride ourselves as being an organization where you can realize your potential through a tailored career path and be part of a company where you belong and matter.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those applicants who are being considered for an interview, or are currently employed by Air Products, will be contacted.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (U.S.). You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, citizenship, gender, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or veteran status.

Cloud Solution Architect -219659

At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.
Our innovation power wouldn’t be possible without our people. That’s why in Boehringer Ingelheim you will have the opportunity to develop your career while improving the world’s health!
If you want to take one step forward in your professional journey in a virtual, international and multicultural environment, Boehringer Ingelheim is the one for you!
Growth together with the team as a and be part of a Global Top Employer company where you will be involved in interesting projects that which will lead you to your fullest development!
THE POSITION
Our IT EDS Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics team is looking for a Solution Architect. Within the team we drive and support high quality, value-adding and user-centric solutions to our customers in Scientific area. As solution architect you will be responsible for technical implementation services, product subject-matter-expertise, and advanced use-case solutions (understand requirements, analyze information, and design comprehensive solutions). and lead projects in the new AWS environment being implemented in close collaboration with Project/product team (e.g. Project managers, Scrum master, Product Owner, business analysts, vendors and other key stakeholders) to craft solutions that are aligned to BI architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and services and meet timeline and financial targets. Your main duties will be:
Tasks and responsibilities
Analyse and understand the existing Business Intelligence components combined with additional requirements on AWS
Lead requirements workshops with scientific area stakeholders to understand processes / components / requirements
Design the overall solution architecture including new data management, data integration and reporting layers based on AWS
Steer and manage the implementation projects by providing necessary direction and guidance to implementation teams and being the quality assurance instance.
Integration into the overall team and alignment of development across the whole application landscape.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics preferred.
At least 5 years of experience in area of business intelligence and data management, with experience as data/solution architect.
At least 3 years of experience with cloud solutions. Solution Architect for at least one large scale modernization / transition project to Cloud (eg AWS, Azure).
Knowledge of AWS components, Apache Parquet, S3, AWS Glue and Amazon Redshift is a plus .
Knowledge of pharma industry, clinical development and/or GxP processes is a plus.
Experience with agile based delivery model.
Knowledge of Classical Technologies: Oracle (Database) and Informatica (ETL).
AWS solution architect certification is a plus.
Understanding of / skills in Tableau are a plus.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Willingness and readiness to travel.
Collaboration skills, excellent analytical thinking and self-organized, able to understand and design complex architecture, self-confident, able to explain, discuss and defend architectural design and decisions. Initiative and a passion for driving rapid technical advancement with innovative ideas.
#IamBoehringerIngelheim because…
With us, you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives. We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, flexible learning and continuous development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.
We are continuously working to create a great employee experience. These are some examples of how we will take care of you:
Flexible working conditions
Life and accident insurance
Health insurance at a competitive price
Investment in your learning and development
Gym membership discounts
If you have read until here, what are you waiting to apply? We want to know more about you!

Puesto - Tecnología de la Información
Ubicación principal - Europe-ES-Cataluña-Sant Cugat del Vallès
Organización - ES-Boehringer Ingelheim España, S.A.
Horario - Tiempo completo

At Kodify we manage several high traffic web platforms developed using the latest technologies and we work hard to provide the best experience for our users.
It is extremely important to us that anyone who joins loves sharing their taste for high-quality products and pays attention to detail. We also value respect, openness, and diversity amongst our teams. We are an international team of around 50 with 13 different nationalities, spread around the world in our different office locations: Barcelona, Altea, Montréal, Los Angeles and several other European countries for the team that works remotely.
We are looking for a passionate, business-oriented, fast decision making and natural leader to be our Product Owner and support our development teams. We expect you to share our values, be transparent and open to giving/receiving feedback in order to work better together as a team towards a common goal. You will have a proven track record of working in Agile methodologies (SCRUM or Kanban) and your capability to turn ideas into product-ready solutions.
Working closely with, and reporting to the Product Manager, you will be responsible for a successful development of our web based products. This includes: defining each step in the product development, prioritising features, building prototypes, overlooking A/B tests with the support of an analyst, interfacing with stakeholders and driving the design and development of successful concepts by working with a cross-functional team.
You will be working closely with engineering, marketing, product, and business in a cohesive and dedicated team to hit aggressive sales targets.
Main responsibilities:
Defining Goals and KPIs for acquisition of new customers
Product owner for all top of funnel development and initiatives related to acquisition (ad optimisation, seo, landing page optimisation, join page conversion)
Involved in setting up, customising and managing analytics & A/B testing tools.
Constant analysis of analytics and product KPIs to identify opportunities for improvements or new features
Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of user stories
Define project scope, goals and deliverables
Manage the full lifecycle of product developments (from concept to execution)
Manage, prioritise and communicate the product backlog to all stakeholders
Drive and motivate a team of developers from a UX perspective
Building a culture of Conversion Rate Optimisation within the business and sharing insights across the teams.
Working closely with dedicated CRO team (UX + Dev) to implement tests with high momentum.
Reviewing and optimising pricing structure of products.
Competitor research of our competitors online campaigns, landing pages and pricing
Requirements
5 years+ working in an product owner, analytics, or data analysis role
Strong analytical and mathematical skills ideally with an academic background in math, statistics, business or marketing.
Expert understanding of the online ad market and ecosystem
Ability to plan, direct and execute online marketing campaigns including email, display and video ads.
Have a great eye for design to ensure content is on brand and successfully converts
Good level in Google Analytics & Tag manager or similar enterprise level analytics package and extensive experience in configuring and customizing an analytics solution.
Extensive track record of using CRO to improve business KPIs and working with A/B testing software
Ability to both define high level analytics & testing strategies and carry out in depth technical data analysis.
Demonstrated track record of creative and structured approach to problem solving.
Experience of using data analysis techniques such as cohort analysis, unit economics, funnel analysis and customer segmentation.
Entrepreneur and innovative with a can-do attitude. Must be a self starter.
Sales driven and determined to reach aggressive objectives and targets.
Expert level in Excel, R or similar data analysis tool and must be able to carry out statistical analysis, data visualisation and custom reporting.
Experience of working closely with design teams to brainstorm UX and design solutions for A/B tests.
Excellent attention to detail and organisation skills.
Experience of working closely with digital marketing teams.
What we offer:
Competitive salary;
½ day off on your birthday;
Health insurance;
Generous vacation and personal days;
Training and development budget;
Kodify off-sites abroad, fun events and regular team activities;
Awesome global offices and locations: Los Angeles, Barcelona, Altea, and Montreal!

About Glovo:
We're a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you'll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your work-life opportunity:
In the GX CIS and Africa Regional team you will be responsible for helping build the bridge between the global Glover Experience strategy and the Local teams. We are looking for someone to connect, understand and push forward solutions to improve the pain points couriers have in each market. By constantly travelling you will need to become the point of contact for all the local teams in Africa and CIS countries (Commonwealth of independent states) to make sure the couriers have satisfied couriers and fair metrics. You will need to have a data sensitive approach to identify, manage and track key performance indicators in each country and as a region. We are looking for a person with a positive attitude, lots of gas, creativity to think out of the box and passion for the work you will develop.
Be a part of a team where you will:
Travel across all the countries in the region CIS and Africa (Kenya, Ivory Coast, Morocco, Uganda, Ghana, Kazakhstan, Kirgkistan, Georgia, Ukraine and more to come)
Understand and adapt the Glover Experience strategy for each of the different countries in the region
Have analytical skills and be able to manage looker/excel/google spreadsheets to be able to develop several actions to implement GX pillars.
Be able to create full communication strategies with clear KPIs and objectives to track, motivate local teams to execute this. And help them with content, channels, targets, and material for the riders/glovers.
Create postmortem documents to analyze the results of each project and be able to easily replicate them in the rest of the countries
Analyze market insights from focus groups, surveys, interviews, and others to understand the riders.
You have:
Degree in International Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or similar
3-5-year experience in Communications or Public relations department is a plus
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Have a Data sensitive approach, fly in Excel and/or Google sheets.
Analytical skills, attention to detail, results oriented, autonomous and efficient.
Ability to work within a team and independently.
Able to lead projects from strategy to execution and results tracking plus be able to roll them out in different teams and countries
People's person, able to connect with different cultures, understand the pain points of couriers in each country and be creative enough to suggest and lead projects to improve Glovers satisfaction and fair kpis.
Team-player and problem-solving skills, a very positive person
Ability to execute fast and well-done activities and events.
Nice-to-haves:
Social media management skills
Graphic Design: logos, posters, flyers, etc.
Video editing skills

Enticing equity plan

Gas: We work with energy, innovation and passion for what we do. We are committed.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone regardless of gender, sexual orientation, religion, and abilities.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. A person with disabilities will be given preferential consideration per local regulations.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working in an account management/sales planning role.
Ability to speak and write in English and one or more of the following languages fluently: French, Italian, Spanish, and/or German.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience with quality assurance processes, including conducting audits, facilitating calibration sessions, and using data to drive continuous improvement.
Familiar with digital advertising, Google Ads, vendor contract terms. Knowledge of Google Ads campaign building and optimization (especially for Builders, Upper Mass Market, and Scaled Onboarding roles).
Strong understanding of selling best practice and techniques (e.g. objection handling, competitive selling).
Demonstrated stakeholder communication and influence skills; ability to influence Google and vendor stakeholders without authority, especially management, via clear, persuasive written and verbal presentations and updates.
About the job
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we. Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) vendor teams help clients and agencies meet their business objectives. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers, and support specialists collaborate closely to identify and create solutions that solve core business and marketing objectives across all types of customer organizations.
Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.
Responsibilities
Monitor internally weekly sales performance metrics and share key market performance insights with Google sales leadership. Consult, externally, on vendor-led weekly business reviews and follow up to deliver results, including sharing best practices and involving Sales leadership or Vendor Strategy Operations.
Ensure vendor service quality against contracted service level agreements and key performance indicators by conducting regular call audits, calibration sessions and quality reviews, sharing data-driven insights and feedback with vendor management and central Google teams.
Manage relationships with vendor sales management (e.g. senior manager) for your line of business, communicating rigorous expectations for delivering against program-specific agreement terms while providing appropriate support, best practices, and guidance.
Provide critical on-the-ground feedback and support to land vendor operations improvement initiatives led by central Google teams. Provide Google product, tool, and process support and cascade central changes.

Are you looking for a job where you are responsible for helping the organization to drive its upsell marketing to the next stage, by defining the relevant segment, build marketing automation campaigns, measure results and coordinate a cross functional team in a Multinational, then this might be the perfect opportunity for you!
To further accelerate our growth and strengthen our leading position we are looking for a highly motivated Sr. Marketing Analyst to join our Marketing Strategy team, from the Barcelona office. You would be part of the department responsible to support our business at European level.
Here’s a little taste of your potential challenges:
You will be responsible to define and implement part of the marketing strategy:
Define the right proposition per type of customer segment, including other Bridgestone group products and services
Detect the most relevant types of upsell, and implement tactics as levers to enhance upsell
Define the customer segmentation per upsell path, implemented in Salesforce, and engage customer-facing teams to use that
Guide the implementation of e-mail marketing campaigns for internal, channel and customers
Be able to measure and re-define the strategy based on results
You will be part a cross functional team to try to reach our upsell sales targets
What we are looking for:
Business or Economics degree, including marketing (Masters highly desirable).
Experience in Upsell Marketing, Customer Value Management, CRM in similar environments.
Business & Commercial focus.
Keen eye for detail and passion for data/reporting integrity.
Determination to propose and implement changes based on reasoned assessments.
3+ years of experience in a similar position.
Fluency in English (verbal and written) is critical.
Expert in e-mail Marketing (Pardot and / or Eloqua), Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Power BI and Salesforce (company CRM) is a plus.
Sociable person who likes to work in a team.
Dependable and takes ownership when faced with challenges.
What can you expect?
You will never get bored! We move fast like a “start-up” but have the backing of a billion-euro company
We like to have fun. There is no sense coming to a job everyday if you don’t like the people you work with
Different cultures. Our colleagues come from all over the world, with 55 nationalities and counting
Let’s not forget the good stuff:
Competitive salary
Private health insurance (including children and partners)
Pension Plan
Lunch Vouchers + free coffee at the office
Birthday off!
The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international environment, dealing with all kind of different countries and cultures
Who are we?
Webfleet Solutions is part of Bridgestone Europe NV/SA (“Bridgestone”), a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a leader in advanced solutions and sustainable mobility.
Webfleet Solutions is one of the world’s leading telematics solution providers, dedicated to fleet management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Its main Software-as-a-Service solution WEBFLEET is used by businesses of all sizes to improve vehicle performance, save fuel, support drivers and increase overall fleet efficiency. In addition, Webfleet Solutions provides services for the insurance, rental and leasing industries, car importers and companies that address the needs of businesses as well as consumers. Webfleet Solutions has over 50,000 customers worldwide and services drivers in more than 100 countries, giving them the industry’s strongest local support network and widest range of sector-specific third-party applications and integrations. Our customers benefit every day from the high standards of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our ISO/IEC 27001:2013 certified service, re-audited in November 2018.

What you do at AMD changes everything


At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.


Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. Enterprise Distribution Sales Account Manager - EMEA

To be responsible for driving business development with Distributors and VAR Partners by evangelizing AMD technology, building and executing sales programs, enabling sales teams through training, managing executive relationships.

Does this sound like you? We'd love to talk!

Ability to self-motivate in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Ability to build relationships and influence Executive contacts
Outstanding organizational and time-management skills
Excellent oral and written communications skills in English and German (+ any additional languages in local countries a plus)
Proven follow-up and closing skills
Strong work ethic
Willing to travel up to 50% of the time
Key Responsibilities:
Achieve and exceed sales targets/quotas
Discover, build, grow and close incremental business opportunities within the EMEA Reseller and Distribution Channel selling AMD-based Commercial Server products
Discover, build, grow and close incremental business opportunities within the key OEMs
Team collaboration with AMD Enterprise End-User and OEM sales teams in support of the Commercial business
Partner with AMD Channel Marketing to develop AMD platform communications, enablement events and training that articulate the benefits of AMD powered solutions
Ensure AMD has relevant focus within key local OEM sales, marketing and executive management

Proven sales experience within a related industry or segment
Local Channel Distribution Partner experience
International business experience
Proficient in English and German

Bachelor's Degree preferred

Germany or Spain

Job Title: CRM Data Analyst (also available for full remote working)
Job Description:
Company Description

Launched in 1998, this pioneering British-born brand has specialized in creating amazing experiences and unforgettable memories - from hotels, city breaks, and holidays to theatre, entertainment, and spa days. Experts in brightening up online travel, lastminute.com is among the worldwide leaders in the field, helping hundreds of thousands of customers every year find, and do, "whatever makes them pink".
lastminute.com is part of lm group, publicly-traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry. Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services.

Job Description

*Please note that is a full remote working position*
lastminute.com is looking for a CRM Data Analyst to better enable digital Mktg teams across channels (display, social, email Mktg, search) to deliver successful campaigns, optimizations and ultimately growth for the company. The right candidate will have full ownership and responsibility to envisage and build channel insights analytics and will be a strong and verbal stakeholder in the trading team to deliver and maximize its KPIs.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze relevant website data by using relevant KPIs and visualize the results
Development, optimization and automation of important reports and dashboards
Ad-hoc- and deep analysis for different business units
Transformation of big data to smart data by deep data analysis.
ETL & Reporting tool usage for Analysis and Report creation
Manage and optimize the data flow between our CRM systems
Derive actions and quick wins from analysis and support the execution (utilize Excel, Google Spreadsheets, SQL, DataStudio and Google Analytics)
Actively participate in the creation of new reporting dashboards for digital marketing campaigns
Assist to coordinate landing page and ad copy tests, including analysis of results. Lead competitive analysis (eg. benchmarking, auction insights etc.)

Qualifications

Essential
Relevant experience in data analysis focusing on web traffic and customer journeys
Basic SQL, Javascript, Python knowledge, Google Big Query, Google Data Studio
Extensive experience in web tracking solutions (e.g. Google Analytics)
Experience in data engineering
Good knowledge of the English language
Desirable
Bachelor or Master’s degree, or equivalent
Vertica & Tibco Spotfire knowledge, knowledge of datavirtuality and Emarsys
Abilities/qualities
Fluency and passion to work with numbers and data analysis (especially Excel and Google spreadsheets are a must)
Comfortable to develop a project independently according to goal setting but also as part of a team
Well developed business sense with constant self drive to deliver KPI achievement and growth

Hello!
At Factorial we're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to help us take our DataOps team to the next level.
We want to develop the extremely talented people in our team, scale the company culture and evangelize our views on how Human Resources can make a difference for organizations all over the world.
About us
Factorial is an HR Software startup founded 5 years ago, we've won awards and received outstanding customer feedback since day one. It has closed over 18M€ in funding with top international venture capital firms (CRV, Creandum, Point Nine Capital and K Fund). Take a look and see how we started: The origin
Our Mission
To help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralize people data and make better business decisions. Currently serves thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, it has built a super talented team of over +200 people in its headquarters in the sunny Barcelona.
Our values ✨
The Role
At Factorial, we have a team of 35 talented and kind engineers. Ownership and accountability are at the core of our values: We will trust you and your team to make and execute decisions. At Factorial, we want people who want to make an impact, and we will do whatever it takes to facilitate it.
Despite being a fast-growing startup, we promote a healthy work-life balance. We are a remote-first and family-friendly organization. We understand that work may not be your priority at all times, so we let you manage your own time and ambitions. We all have good and bad moments, and work shouldn't feel like a burden.
We have an open Senior Data Analyst position for our new DataOps team. This is one of the most strategic teams with a big technical challenge ahead and a greenfield opportunity. We want humans who can make a business impact through technology.
What you will do❓
You will spend the first two weeks learning the domain, data model, and processes.
You will attend a weekly meeting to talk about the team, projects, and strategic initiatives.
You will join and lead conversations with stakeholders and customers to understand the organization's data needs.
You will provide and maintain a set of reports (product, finance, operations) to help the company make informed decisions.
You will discover opportunities with the tools and infrastructure and work together with the team to seize them.
You will iterate on the quarterly OKR definition with the team until you find one you feel comfortable committing to.
You will understand all the nuances of the domain and how the technology implements it to mentor people in the organization.
You will enable the rest of the organization to build and consume data products.
Who are you? ✔️
You are friendly and prefer Socratic discussion over winning arguments.
You have led technological decisions that had strategic outcomes.
You have extensive experience using data to achieve goals.
You think about systems and can create replicable solutions to common problems.
You are proficient in SQL and perhaps, other programming languages used in data (Python, Java, Scala...).
You have experience with some BI or visualization tools: Tableau, PowerBI, Metabase, Jupyter notebooks, etc...
What do we offer?
50.000€ Salary + equity
Flexible time off and schedule (within reasonable limits).
Full-remote flexibility (you decide whenn you want to work remotely or from the office)
Budget for learning & development
What's next after I apply?

Perks of being part of our team

High growth, multicultural and friendly environment
No/Flexible schedules!
Free physiotherapy in the office once a week!
Full remote flexibility
AXA private health insurance
Healthy life with Andjoy (Gyms, pools, outdoor classes) ‍ ️
Save expenses with Cobee
Language classes with Yolk Academy & Factorial Language exchange ‍
Get the most out of your salary with Devengo
Breakfast in the office and organic fruit
Syra discounts ❗
Free caffeine and theine
Pet Friendly
Diversity is part of us, we have more than 25 countries in our teams and we promote an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, come join the team!
Want to know more about us? We #betonpeople

At Zurich Klinc we’re reinventing insurance to make it more valuable to people. We’re Barcelona-based insurtech start-up style project escalating our business at European level. Klinc became our top Digital E2E insurance platform focusing on delivering value to our customer life’s in three main areas: Property, Mobility and Life & Wellness.

What are we looking for?

We are currently looking for a Business Analyst who will support and empower the team to make data-driven decisions across the business, for example acquisition, portfolio management and other insurance areas. The aim is to leverage data and identify opportunities for improvement, as well as recognize potential issues and offer solutions, to drive profits to the business. They will be responsible for analyzing data to identify trends and patterns that inform future business decisions.

The main duties and responsibilities will include:

Stakeholder management and influence to make things happen
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities in increase sales, retention, and profitability
Learning and fully understanding the end-to-end business
Using and developing data collection processes
Gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements
Developing dashboards and creating reports and supporting users with them
Communicating insights to senior management and across the organization
Consolidation of learnings: what worked, what didn’t and what can be improved.

What do we need?

Similar experience working as Business Analyst with improvement and growth proposals
Interest about Insurance and Digital products
Business Orientation
Stakeholder management
Experiencie working with some BI tools (Data Studio, Power BI, Tableau)
Good English level
Good Excel level

For being from Zurich


At Zurich we want to take care of you and these are some of your benefits:


- Flexible compensation.
Restaurant card.
Home office voucher.
Flexwork: 20 hours a week to work where and when you want.
- Pension plan - Life insurance.
Bank and insurance offer.
Discount in gyms.
Zurich Wellness, sports activities.
Zurich Sports Club, free registration for marathons and popular races.
Free English classes.

About us
Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You would give them confidence and peace of mind by protecting what they love the most. It is a great challenge, but you will have the support of a great international team that is ready to help you so that you can reach your full potential and thus fulfill our promises. We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us? "Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer"
Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Job Title: 2022 Corporate & Investment Bank Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship July - December (Madrid)
Job Description:
What to expect
Our Off-Cycle Analyst Program runs for six months from July to December. We will give you relevant support and training, arming you with technical and practical skills that will help you hit the ground running.
You'll make an impact by:

Analysing market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations for mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and capital markets advisory.
Managing client transactions from pitch to close under the guidance of our senior leaders.
Coming up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges.
Learning how we help clients and communities grow, no matter their needs.
Sharpening your technical skills.
Building your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others.
The program is an opportunity to take your career to the next level through hands-on experience, relevant skills training and valuable professional networking.
About You
If you've got initiative and the vision to come up with strategies and plans, then this is the role for you.
Key skills and eligibility criteria include:

Excellent analytical, quantitative and interpretative skills
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative work environment
Being adaptable, flexible and resilient
Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Fluency in English and Spanish is a prerequisite.
You must be a final-year student or recent graduate, eligible to start full-time by June 2022. If you plan to pursue further education beyond your undergraduate studies, please ensure this is accurately reflected in the graduation date entered on your application.
A well-rounded academic background is important - being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in your undergraduate studies is preferred. You certainly don't need a degree in Economics or Finance, but a good level of numeracy is required.
But beyond that, what we're most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
What's next?
Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
To start the application, you will be prompted to enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile so make sure it is one you will have long term access to. Do not use an email address with ".edu" extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.
After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.
You'll receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
HireVue is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this required element as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

Job Title: Sales Market Analyst Internship - French Market
Job Description:
Hello!
At Factorial we're looking for a Sales Market Analyst Intern for the French Market to help us take the company to the next level.
We want to develop the extremely talented people in our team, scale the company culture and evangelize our views on how Human Resources can make a difference for organizations all over the world.
About us
Factorial is an HR Software startup founded 5 years ago, we've won awards and received outstanding customer feedback since day one. It has closed over 18M€ in funding with top international venture capital firms (CRV, Creandum, Point Nine Capital and K Fund). Take a look and see how we started: The origin
Our Mission
To help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralize people data and make better business decisions. Currently serves thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, it has built a super talented team of over +200 people in its headquarters in the sunny Barcelona.
Our values ✨
The Role
You will be part of an international sales team of 200+ people from 20+ countries. You will be a pioneer in your own market, helping us do whatever it takes to achieve the ambitious goals we have for 2021.
If you feel like this is you, join our special and energetic sales family right away.
At the end of the internship, if you demonstrate that you are responsible, proactive and you have a sales DNA, you will have the possibility to join our company and grow professionaly!

Requirements
Who are we looking for?
You can easily hold a business conversation in French
Eager to learn, self-motivated, proactive and driven by achievement.
Excellent communication skills.
Flexibility to adapt to different situations and able to communicate on different levels, a creative concept of sales.
You understand and take ownership of the importance of your role. You will not be just another employee, your efforts and ideas will have a direct impact on Factorial’s success.
Bonus Points
have experience using tools like Hubspot, Salesforce, Loom, Excel
have experience in Sales at a SaaS-based company
have a solid understanding of how to roll out successful outbound campaigns

Flexible, fast learner

Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

What you will be doing:
Within Criteo FP&A Expenses team we are looking for a talented FP&A analyst, based in Barcelona, to help monitor key expenses on a set of organizations (mostly Sales & Operations), as well as being a trusted FP&A business partner to these organizations. This role requires solid knowledge of core FP&A processes, performance management and business modelling acumen as well as strong communication and influencing skills.
In this role, you will have the responsibility to:
Partner with Budget owners: be a trustful and reliable finance support for the teams you support to drive sound decision-making support to each leader in relation to transformation, their organization and strategic matters.
Financial and business planning: own the preparation of planning, budgeting and quarterly reforecasting of expense, & HC in cooperation with each organization’s leadership team, Strategic & Commercial Finance.
Financial analysis and modelling: model various ad-hoc expense/HC scenarios, sensitivity analyses, profitability analysis (in collaboration with FP&A Revenue team) along with providing valuable and impactful insights on costs drivers and optimization levers to each leadership team, Strategic & Commercial Finance.
Financial performance monitoring: monitor the monthly and quarterly performance of expense and related business/financial objectives along with providing insight on the underlying drivers to key stakeholders (each organization’s leadership team, S&C Finance and Corporate FP&A)
Close and accrual process: contribute and ensure the accuracy and completeness of closing activities of expenses (accruals), in collaboration with Corporate FP&A team.
Contribute to ad-hoc project: related to forecast process streamlining or tools improvements
Who you are:
At least 4 years experience in Financial Planning & Analysis in a public, multinational company, audit or consulting firm (Big 4)
Bachelor or Master degree in Finance
Good knowledge of P&L and general accounting process & procedure
Ability to deal with complexity and to handle multiple tasks concurrently
A "hands on" proactive and self-driven attitude is required; who enjoys challenges and thrives in a fast changing and demanding environment.
Client oriented mind with integrity and solid analytical skills, humble and self-aware
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to interact and influence senior management level
Fluent in English, other language skills appreciated
International experience with proven ability to work with people from different cultures is a plus
High proficiency in MS Office including Excel and Power Point. Skills on Power BI, Qlick, Tableau or any other data visualization tools is a plus.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Who we are
Paack is an avant-garde technology start-up in the logistics sector. It was founded in 2015, and since then, the company has experienced strong global growth and it currently operates in 70 cities across different countries such as Spain, UK, France, and Portugal. Our success is backed by renowned European investors.
We believe the future of e-commerce deliveries is a customer-controlled system that schedules the distribution according to clients’ preferences. Additionally, our approach blends the last mile delivery experience with an environmental-friendly service. Paack wants to establish the combination of the two as the new market standard. Hence, we ensure clients receive their parcels in a time that suits them while contributing to sustainability.
Our product ecosystem was designed in-house allowing both technology and operationality to integrate perfectly, delivering parcels more efficiently. This results in unprecedented outcomes, offering our retail clients a competitive advantage whilst reducing the impact of their carbon footprint. Due to previously mentioned reasons, some of the best retailers (Amazon, Inditex Group (Zara), H&M, El Corte Inglés, etc) have chosen Paack as their exclusive partner.
Our team of Paackers is multicultural, multilingual, and highly qualified. We enjoy the challenges of scaling a global technology and logistics business, facing them with ambition.
In accordance with our corporate values: We Care, We Thrive, We Innovate, Paack is looking for inspiring people, people who love to grow exceeding expectations and challenge status quo.
Paack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace.

What you will do
Reporting to the FPA & C Manager, this is a crucial role for as it is essential for us to monitor and enhance our operational margins in our actual and future subsidiaries.
Your main tasks will include:
Contribute to the margins’ calculation processes on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Maintain data bases updated for the correct flow of information with the Business Intelligence software.
Report and communicate the economic performance as well as defining and follow up action plans to improve the metrics.
Assist to identify and analyze the monthly and YTD deviations.
Seek identity between financial and cost accounting so we can deliver a reliable reporting.
Prepare financial modelling for various “what if” scenarios and the overall impact to the business unit.
Assist on projects to improve the scalability of the margin control processes.
Assist members of other departments in answering project accounting and finance questions.
And any other initiative will be welcome.

What we look for ️‍ ️
The role is a perfect combination of finance and data analysis and that’s why Excel skills should be high. Experience in Microsoft Dynamics, Qlik Sense, Macros and SQL will be much appreciated. We are working with Looker BI to keep track of all these metrics that will allow us to master the efficiency of our operations.
Communication, people management skills and experience with multicultural profiles and cross-cultural management is also required.
Other important skills are:
Optimistic and positive feedback addicted
Great social skills, empathy and comprehension
Highly motivated and results driven person
Proactivity and problem-solving skills
• Responsibility, ownership and initiative • Ability to work under pressure in a rapidly changing environment
Enthusiasm and great work capacity
Professional English fluency

What we offer
The usual side, immediate incorporation and flexible remote work schedule.
The amazing side, the opportunity to take part in one of the main areas in any start-up and deliver an impactful contribution by helping us to manage our financial performance.

Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

IT Analyst - TPM

The following position is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?
Beam Suntory inspires human connections, memorable stories and family legacies by Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest premium spirits company... where each employee is treated like family and trusted to be custodians of our world-class portfolio of brands steeped in legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit.

Beam Suntory currently has the following position open in Madrid, Spain - IT Trade Promotion Analyst (TPM)

This is a Great Opportunity because
Beam Suntory is a leader in the spirits industry with a track record of profitability and growth
Join a team of talented individuals which are part of the latest IT trends and ongoing companywide growth initiatives
Ongoing professional development and promotion opportunities
Work with subject matter experts in the Spirits industry

Role Responsibilities
Description

The IT Analyst (TPM) must be an analytical, problem solving, solution-oriented individual who will be a member of the IT Sales & Marketing team. This role provides day-to-day support on IT TPM initiatives and reports to the IT Trade Promotion Manager.

The TPM Analyst must be self-driven, with strong business process knowledge, analytical skills, excellent communication, and good presence within a team. The TPM Analyst will support a new, modernized approach to develop a new process and solution to the organization. This represents a significant change in capabilities driving adoption and optimization of the solution is critical to support our growing business. This role will support the establishment of support tools, reports, and processes for system users in a way that we can extend, integrate and optimize the platform. This role is critical in the strategic direction of TPM and the expansion of new markets.

Overview / Responsibilities
Understanding of Company offerings including features and benefits, market position, competitive products, marketing activities, pricing, etc.
Work cross-functionally to drive initiatives forward.
Provide day to day support to users.
Partner closely with the IT TPM Business Analyst resource to support the process and system.
Provide high level user support and work to drive adoption by users.
Act as a Subject Matter Expert of the process and application.
Capture new requirements, work with our support and development teams to prioritize and successfully deliver initiatives.
Identify pain points and provide solutions.
Provide ongoing training for users as well as updates and education on new features, benefits, reports, etc.
Develop and maintain system documentation
Drive adoption through communication and training (one on one, group, webinars).
This is a technical role and requires the technical background – TPM application experience is required, Salesforce experience / knowledge is preferred.

Culture/Motivational Fit

The candidate who will be a strong motivational/cultural fit should demonstrate a high degree of the following traits:
Customer Focused - Anticipates, monitors and meets the needs of customers and responds to them in an appropriate manner. Demonstrates a personal commitment to identify customers' apparent and underlying needs and continually seeks to provide the highest quality service and product to all customers.
Adaptability - Adjusts planned work by gathering relevant information and applying critical thinking to address multiple demands and competing priorities in a changing environment.
Results-Oriented - Demonstrates concern for achieving or surpassing results against an internal or external standard of excellence. Shows a passion for improving the delivery of services with a commitment to continuous improvement.
Communication – Demonstrates excellent communication, listening and interpersonal skills at all levels of the organization. Demonstrates an ability to influence others by modeling appropriate body language and nonverbal communication.
Organizing and Planning - Establishes a systematic course of action for self or others to ensure the accomplishment of a specific objective. Sets priorities, goals, and timetables to achieve maximum productivity.
Problem Solving - Builds a logical approach to address problems or opportunities or manage the situation at hand by drawing on one’s knowledge and experience base and calling on other references and resources as necessary.


Qualifications & Experience

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or similar degree
Years of experience: 3-5 years of working with CPG company supporting TPM
Level of experience: Technical background, TPM application experience required
Industry experience: CPG and Sales preferable but not required
Project Management experience a plus
Knowledge of Salesforce.com and SAP systems desired
Experience working with large data sets and business intelligence tools, i.e. Tableau
Self-motivated, focused on continuous skill development and growth
Ability to multitask, prioritize and work in fast paced environment
Role based in Madrid, Spain
Travel less than 10% (if any)

Who we are

The Workshop is a tech company that develops intuitive software for the online gaming industry. Our motto is to move “Fearlessly Forward” together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything we do – from our games, new products and technologies, to how we collaborate and share inspiration with one another.
We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes. Our forte lies in the diversity of our skills – and that comes from the diversity of our people.
We are committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, where we all learn together, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof), and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a friendly, supportive working environment for all. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and enjoy the support to move Fearlessly Forward.
Your mission
As an "Operational Analyst" you will analyse, review and assess the structure and operation of our ITSG services to ensure that we understand the performance of these services and have the necessary data and information to make proposals to support Continuous Improvement. This Analyst will be hands-on with sourcing and mining data, analysing it, and presenting information to stakeholders within ITSG to support them in decision making and the Continuous Improvement of the services they provide. They will work across all the teams in ITSG to identify opportunities where data analytics can bring benefit and value, source and mine the data, and produce the information that supports Continuous Improvement.
With a focus on automation, you will need to identify processes improvements that would increase repeatability and scalability. The new solutions will provide value as profitability, efficiency, and productivity to reduce the operational footprint for operating teams.
What you'll do
Understand Organization needs to improve ITSG services and processes
Work with ITSG teams to identify areas and aspects that need improvement and identify the data needed to perform the analysis
Plan and design the data analytics solution to source, mine, analyse and present information
Focus on automation and orchestration
Evaluate and select the appropriate technology to support data analytics
Develop and implement technology to support the goals and objectives of data analytics
What you'll bring
Analytical mindset and any transferable experience of analysing how processes and services can be improved
Passion for data-driven continuous improvement
Experience in working with data at least to the level of understanding the importance of data in scientific research
Preferably experience of applying data analytics to continuous improvement in some operational context
Love of working with people from all different backgrounds and cultures
Desire to work with stakeholders at all levels of an organization
What's in it for you
Inspiring and fulfilling work at an innovative and values-driven company creating cutting-edge tech
Attractive salary and customisable benefits package
Flexible working hours and ways of working
Contemporary and accessible office environments with a range of workplace perks
Six weeks’ paid leave for every four years of service
Relocation package for you and your family including soft-landing package services to help you settle in (applicable in Spain, if you are moving from a different city/country)
Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and agile working practices
A friendly, inclusive and multicultural environment (we are made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking almost 30 languages)
Wellbeing programmes, learning and personal growth opportunities
A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Learning Labs, Hackathons and Designathons
Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside of the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing

The Process Excellence team enables sales growth and overall company productivity by designing best in class sales and finance processes and tools with an end to end vision.

Your missions :

For the end-to-end processes in your scope (Lead-to-Cash), participate to projects to ensure Criteo has appropriate policies, efficient processes supported by user-friendly technology.
Provide overview and documentation on the processes, technologies, and policies in your scope, identify the risk area or improvement opportunities, and propose action plans.

Stays abreast of process trends and leading practices occurring in the marketplace to inform strategic direction and process enhancement.

Improving Lead To Cash Efficiency (from Commercial to Finance processes).

1 to 2 years of experience in the review and reengineering of Lead to Cash process

Culture of team player is required for a success in the role.
