Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

What you will be doing:
Within Criteo FP&A Expenses team we are looking for a talented FP&A analyst, based in Barcelona, to coordinate the monitoring, analysis and forecast of the company’s expenses financial performance, in close collaboration with various bodies in Criteo including the FP&A Revenue team, Corp FP&A, Tax, conso.
In this role, you will have the responsibility to:
Contribute in Financial Planning Process for Expenses and headcount at a company level:
Facilitate the roll-out of guidelines, KPI definitions and planning assumptions & operational slicing in collaboration with the Strategic and Commercial Finance Team, as well as the Business Planning, Tools and process team
Consolidate, analyse and challenge bottom-up forecasts from regions and Product Units
Provide recommendations and close-the-gap options
Prepare simulations and modelling based on multi-scenario external factors, business drivers and operating KPIs
Deliver insightful analyses for decision-making at Executive level
Contribute to 3YP exercise
Support performance monitoring at company level:
Track and analyse a set of operational KPIs (monthly, quarterly, yearly)
Contribute in preparing top quality reporting packages distributed to the Board of Directors and CFO (monthly, quarterly)
Interface with the Corp team
Interface with the conso team for top entries
Contribute to coordinate the recurring reforecasting exercises
Operationalize guidance for the Expense team
Support the review of the bottom up to perfect the forecast accuracy at the Digital Finance hub level
Who you are:
Minimum 6 years of professional experience in FP&A with significant exposure to fast business dynamics environments
Strong culture of modelling and data analytics, solid Excel & Power point expertise. Skills on Webi, Power BI, Qlick, Tableau or any other data visualization tools is a plus
A "hands on" proactive and self-driven attitude is required; who enjoys challenges and thrives in a fast changing and demanding environment.
Client oriented mind with integrity and solid analytical skills, humble and self-aware
Fluent in English. International experience with capacity to work with people from different cultures is a plus
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to interact and influence senior management level

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Experience in the Tourism industry.

Job Title: Data Analyst & Architect - CLP (Corporate Life & Pensions)
Job Description:
Who we are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Our opportunity
Global Digital Platforms – CLP IT (Corporate Life & Pensions) is expanding its team support the CLP data strategy globally. You will be the technical product owner of the CLP data strategy, work closely with the business stakeholders and translate business needs into data solutions.

Your role
As a CLP Data Analyst & Architect your main responsibilities will involve:
Work with CLP Business stakeholders to identify the best translation of business requirements into data solutions
Design, develop and deliver the appropriate solutions, in line with Zurich policies and processes and regulatory requirements.
Collaborating with colleagues from across the wider CLP IT & BIZ team
Guide the Business Stakeholders to use the solutions in the optimal way and help the deployment of the solutions
Lead and instruct the development team, providing them with detailed technical requirements
Ensure adherence to Zurich and CLP data architecture
Ensure ongoing maintenance of deployed solutions

Your Skills and Experience
As a CLP Data Analyst & Architect your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
Bachelors degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics/Statistics and 3 or more years of experience in related field
Proven skills in working in database management, business analysis, architecture
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English is mandatory, other languages are a plus
Strong interest in designing, delivering, and maintaining business solutions
Preferred Qualifications:
SQL - Proficiency Level Advanced
Programming - Proficiency Level Intermediate
Data Warehousing - Proficiency Level Advanced
Knowledge of Insurance Industry - Proficiency Level Basic
Data Modeling - Proficiency Level Intermediate
Data Architecture domain knowledge - Proficiency Level Advanced
Azure Data Factory - Proficiency Level Intermediate

Additional Information
As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Life Insurance
Exclusive Employees discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Primary work location is Barcelona. Occasional travel may be required.

Who we are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Permanent - Full-time

We are hiring a Chief Revenue Officer based in Barcelona to pilot the Revenue management team of a leading digital services company in the travel sector. Your mission will be to improve and optimize the revenues of the company by creating a sustainable strategy for future growth and delivering accurate revenue projections.

Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) for Immfly, Barcelona

The Company

Immfly is an award-winning provider of next-generation Digital Services based in Barcelona. They enable airlines to broadcast premium entertainment content, shopping experiences, flight info, advertising and other services, at high streaming speeds, directly on passenger's personal devices. Immfly’s products and services reach millions of passengers across hundreds of destinations in Europe, Africa, Asia, North and South America.

Your Profile

You have +5 years of experience in Revenue management and Pricing
You have experience managing teams of analysis of revenue
You are proficient in English (If you also speak Spanish is a plus!)
You have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or Engineering
You hold a proven track record in improving revenues
You are proficient with numbers and analysis
You have a great ability to work with complex revenue models
You have experience in revenue management in the SaaS or technology industries. In the airline or hospitality industries are also valuable.
You provide accurate analysis and reports
You have good communication and leadership skills
You have a keen interest in travel and travel tech

Your Responsibilities

Responsible for the performance, strategy and alignment of all departments within the organization that have any relation to revenue generation
Be accountable for the revenue targets at a company level
Decide on the optimal price structures of different products according to the relevant factors
Ensure profitability of all customers and product/services categories, by growing revenue from the client base
Identifying and delivering new revenue opportunities in our market
Be aware of the status of the company budget targets and challenges in order to proactively take actions to mitigate any deviation
You will ensure that the KPIs and OKRs of your department are achieved
Be accountable for the MRR, ARR and revenue churn
Communicate effectively revenue performances to the management committee
Manage forecasting models combined with recent data and knowledge of customer behaviour to deliver accurate revenue projections
Implement a tech strategy that delivers accurate data that can be used for decision-making
Work with the Product team to propose improvements
Work closely with the Sales team in supporting commercial proposals and Business Case building and analysis.
Craft and execute a world-class SaaS sales strategy
Work closely with the CFO in budgeting and forecasting
Provide pricing analysis
Analyse customer dynamics to maximize revenues
Perform analysis of future trends including growth, seasonality, competitors' actions among others, and proactively define strategies to minimize threats and seize opportunities
Provide support and trainings to the junior analysts

Benefits:

Full-time, permanent contract
Competitive salary
Annual bonus
Flexible Retribution Plan that allows you to choose between different options, according to your needs and preferences (health insurance, meal ticket, transport ticket, childcare voucher)
Work in a modern office in Barcelona
Flexible working hours and remote work options
Cross-cultural experience in an international environment with a dynamic team.
Company phone line and laptop
Work on your personal development and take the next step in your career
Be part of a talented, ambitious and dynamic C-level team

Are you ready to be directly involved in decision-making on the strategy and growth of the company? It's the perfect time to join Immfly as they continue shaping the future of in flight retail & entertainment.

This is a fantastic opportunity to help you take the next step in your career. If you feel like you meet the requirements and are willing to join our great team, apply to this offer!

Job Title: Sr. Manager, Regional Marketing - Southern Europe
Job Description:
Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career
We’re looking for a results-oriented, performance-driven Marketing leader to manage the marketing strategy, plans and execution of Southern Europe (SEUR). SEUR includes France, Spain, Italy, Portugal, Israel & the Alps countries.
You will partner with the Area Sales Vice President and the EMEA Theatre Go-To-Market solutions teams (GTM) to build data-driven plans supporting Go-To-Market and regional sales strategies to generate awareness and drive quality pipeline with a target contribution for the business. You will guide your direct reports to extend that partnership to district and channel managers to ensure they have input into and understand the plan objectives, strategy and activities in support of their business. The successful candidate will have a proven record of strategic planning, field and channel marketing experience - and isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves alongside the rest of our team.

Your Impact
Lead, develop and orchestrate the marketing strategy and plans in Southern Europe (SEUR) to achieve marketing contribution pipeline and conversion targets
Partner and develop a trusted peer relationship with sales leadership and cross functional leaders on the overall strategy and expected marketing results for the area.
Manage the field and channel marketing resources in SEUR to create an integrated field and channel plan to deliver the leads and pipeline required to support the area
Directly execute and own a broad range of critical components of your marketing strategy focused on top accounts, industries and segments, using the full marketing mix (events, digital..)
Actively engage and align with the in-theatre GTM marketing teams on the GTM priorities and strategy to serve your area
Actively advise and work with the GTM campaign teams and demand generation teams on your region’s needs as they develop, plan, execute, and measure supporting demand generation campaigns
Educate, enable and support your sales teams on how to leverage and utilize the marketing campaigns and activities running in the area
Educate and enable the sales team on accepting and converting leads to opportunities
Drive regular communication on metrics and XPortfolio marketing activities execution progress for SEUR, including activities managed centrally by the marketing GTM teams touching your area
Use data and strategic account insight to establish, forecast and report against key success metrics as well as drive customer satisfaction and loyalty
Drive local, high-touch, thought leadership activity to build C-level communities around the topic of cybersecurity
Deliver an operational excellence cadence with your team by managing your budgets, SFDC campaigns and leads process to meet operational targets and SLAs
Act as the voice of marketing for SEUR

Qualifications

Your Experience
Minimum 12 years best-in-class marketing experience within an IT, high tech, B2B, marketing or sales environment, preferably with an understanding of security and its role in the future of technology
Excellent communicator with proven ability to clearly convey complex ideas and data in written, presentation and spoken formats to a variety of audiences
Ability to influence and build trusted relationships with direct and matrixed stakeholders
Ability to learn and fully articulate the Palo Alto Networks portfolio proposition and GTM pitches
Ability to provide consultative input to senior sales leaders & business partners
Solid understanding of business management and operations including finance, revenue and pipeline principles
Develop business strategy and tactic metrics for success based on solid business and analyst data
People management experience is preferred. Hiring, managing and motivating a marketing team to drive results
Experience in account-based marketing and C-level executive programs is desirable
“Do whatever it takes” attitude. A unique and proven ability to develop strategy and execute, day in and day out, at an incredibly high level against consistent results
Willingness to learn, embrace challenges, persist in the face of setbacks, see effort as a path to mastery, learn from criticism and find lessons and inspiration in the success of others

Additional Information

Your Team
Our marketing team has an opportunity like no other industry: high impact work and the chance to change the future of digital security. This team builds materials for our partners, our sales teams, and our industry. Being in marketing at Palo Alto Networks means that you will be in the midst of the changes impacting our industry, and helping our internal teams, customers, and partners address the ever-changing threats we all face on a day-to-day basis.
Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

The Process Excellence team enables sales growth and overall company productivity by designing best in class sales and finance processes and tools with an end to end vision.

Your missions :

Establish and communicate a clear vision for the Sales and Finance Processes in your scope.
Lead projects to ensure Criteo has appropriate policies, efficient processes supported by user-friendly technology.
Provide overview and documentation on the processes, technologies, and policies in your scope, identify the risk area or improvement opportunities, and propose action plans.
Participate to operational decision when the processes in your scope can be impacted (deal desk, OpCom) to ensure we maintain or improve efficiency, agility and customer satisfaction.
Contribute to building the training for the process changes deployment and ensure the business units and functions train appropriately their teams on the processes.
Actively engage with the company’s business units and impacted functions to adopt and embrace globally standardized processes. For this purpose, leverage your relations with process analysts located in finance teams, and sales effectiveness.
Drive the transformation of the processes in your scope towards best practice processes and determine the standards to be applied to these processes.
Drive global deployment and adoption of standardized processes, with regional and local requirements customized as required to satisfy legal and/or tax compliance.
Monitor compliance of company’s business units and function to the finance processes and alert process owners in case of deviations.
Develop and translate the Sales and Finance transformation strategy into operational goals, objectives, and process roadmaps and identifies necessary resources (people and capital) to support the implementation of these strategies.
Contribute to project prioritization exercises (roadmap) for projects impacting your scope of processes.
Identify impacts on finance processes of the company projects and contribute as process specialists to those projects
Stays abreast of process trends and leading practices occurring in the marketplace to inform strategic direction and process enhancement.
You will manage business process analysts.

Your main responsabilities :

Improving Lead To Cash Efficiency (from Commercial to Finance processes), through efficient combination with our LTO specialists.
Deploy Standard Operating Procedures from an end to end view including project management.
Ensure end to end Lead to cash process efficiency : from simplification to standardization
Set KPIs to monitor Sales and Finance performance/adherence on lead to cash standard processes.
Partner with Sales and Financial Executives and Leaders across the company
Contribute to Sales Excellence and Finance Excellence Communities
Project Manage and design processes and ensure proper governance model and long term vison of Lead To Cash process and technologies (CRM, Social Selling, Data Intelligence, 3rd party vendors management, monetization platform)
Work closely with IIT and R&D departments, make sure business priorities are adequately defined and transferred to maximize impact of deliveries, ensure expected business benefits are defined and quantified
Contribute to transformational group projects impacting Sales and Finance organization (New Business Models, M&A…)

Who you are :

10 years + of experience
Experience of interaction and presentations to Executives is a must
Expert in Sales and Finance processes, and project management, ability to drive a full end to end process view
Experience in managing commercial teams and financial teams in an international transformation context
Ability to drive complex business model implementation and company programs
Strong skillset in transversal coordination across key corporate functions: Commercial, Marketing, Product, Finance and Technology
Culture of team player is required for a success in the role.
Strong ability to formalize, articulate and present clearly complex topics in order to bring clarity and foster alignment
Adaptability in a highly moving environment
Fluent English speaker and writer

Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

The (Customer Success Manager (CSM), Site Solutions will be responsible for increasing the adoption and expansion of SiteVault Free. The CSM will provide consultation to customers that is strategic, data-driven, relationship-oriented and technical while also contributing to the overall Site Solutions team at Veeva.

This is a remote, full-time permanent role with Veeva. This is a customer-facing role and we have no work location requirement if you are in close proximity to an airport and able to meet future travel requirements.

Veeva Systems does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B, OPT) for this employment position
What You'll Do
Strategic Consultation
Partner with research sites to make them committed advocates of SiteVault Free and active, engaged customers
Support sites with low expansion and/or adoption by highlighting and increasing the value that SiteVault Free provides their organization
Support the long-term success of more complex sites as they work to implement SiteVault Free across multiple areas within their organization

Data-Driven Consultation
Onboard new SiteVault Free customers
Identify key SiteVault metrics to track successful usage over time for various research site types (often with unique needs)
Develop and implement adoption and expansion plans for sites in order to proactively ensure and measure their continued success with SiteVault Free

Relationship-Oriented Consultation
Earn the trust and respect of research sites in order to promote transparent communication and gain a clear understanding of their challenges and goals
Build relationships with low adopting SiteVault Free sites and work to provide them with more value
Schedule routine check-ins to support a successful transition for key SiteVault Free to SiteVault Enterprise customers when appropriate
Support the success of SiteVault user communities

Technical Consultation
Possess strong technical understanding of SiteVault Free
Understand and articulate the benefits of available configurations in SiteVault Enterprise
Connect the specific challenges research sites face with clear solutions in SiteVault Free through product demonstrations whenever possible
Stay abreast of evolving features in SiteVault Free and identify their value to customers overall as well as to individual customers

Dedicated Team-Player
Support and communicate with sales team regarding potential Enterprise customers
Provide insight to product team on behalf of SiteVault Free customers
Support marketing with messaging and engagement for research sites
Work closely with training and support to ensure SiteVault Free customers’ needs are met
Requirements
Two - three years of experience working at a clinical research site in the US
See technology as playing a pivotal role in solving the many challenges research sites face today
Understand and have awareness of clinical research regulatory processes at research sites
Possess strong communication, public speaking, organizational, interpersonal, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Nice to Have
Experience with using, implementing and/or managing an electronic regulatory system at a clinical research site
Experience with using, implementing and/or managing a clinical trial management system at a clinical research site
Experience with tracking operational data to drive decision-making, inform process and identify priorities
Experience managing clinical research teams
Experience as a user across a broad range of clinical research technology applications
#LI-Remote

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Who are we?
PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. We have built a fast, intuitive and automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus and what really matters: their employees. Through PayFit, employees have a dedicated access for their payslips and are able to manage efficiently their leave and expense requests.To build such a solution, we have created our own programming language: JetLang. Thanks to JetLang we were able to code Labour Code and collective agreements, and today we continue to add new features.We have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France since 2015 and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain, the UK and Italy.More than 4000 companies such as Big Mamma, MinuteBuzz or Sellsy to name a few already trust us. Over 500 PayFiters have already joined the adventure and we have raised 95M€ to keep growing.

Your missions
Within the global Data team, you will be positioned to contribute to the PayFit growth. You'll:- Interpret data & analyze results using statistical and analytical techniques and provide ongoing reports.- Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain reports and analytical models.- Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.- Work with management and finance teams to prioritize business and information needs.- Proactively locate and define new process improvement opportunities.- Communicate results and influence key business leaders.- Collaborate with the data engineers, analytics engineers and the Head of Data to develop and own our data pipelines, infrastructure & roadmap.

This job has been tailored for you if...
Must haves: - you have 2+ years experience in an analytical role- you have a strong logic & business sense- you are autonomous, self-starter, detail-oriented- you are proactive, and have a problem-solving mindset- you have strong communication skills- you have strong analytical & data driven skills- you have working experience with SQL and data visualization tools Nice to have : - Experience with Looker- Experience with dbt- Familiarity with a scripting language (Preferred: Python)

We are meant to work together if...
- you are a real team player who wants to build a big success story with us,- you speak both french and english fluently and you want to work in an international and dynamic environment,- you have strong interpersonal and communication skills,- you want to learn, improve and gain responsibility.

What we offer ❤️
- an amazing working environment, designed for kindness and blossoming,- an international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona, London),- remote friendly policy,- a gym inside the office and Gymlib subscription with preferential rate,- regular team and global events,- great coffee, fruits, snacks, foosball, MPG Teams or even team yoga classes,- MacBooks are our standard, but we'll provide whatever equipment you need to help you get your job done!

Hiring process ️
1️⃣ Applicant initial validation: added value, key achievements, motivations, job match
2️⃣ Visio interview & short case study with Aida, our Head of Data
3️⃣ Visio interviews with our Data Analysts & Data Engineers
4️⃣ Visio meeting with the Finance Team & our CFO
5️⃣ Visio “BBQ test” to socialize and get to know the team

Want to know more about our epic team? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0uqNUw2JIk We are looking for passionate and innovative people who want to build the next big success story with us! Do you recognize yourself in these words? Do you want to join an incredible adventure?Tell us who you are, what you’ve done and what you're looking to achieve. We’ll be more than happy to meet you :)

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers' behaviour, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you'll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you'll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis.
Visualize and present analyses and results to senior stakeholders, including: Analytics Leads, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product leads, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Requirements
2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g Physics, Stats, Maths, Engineering) & social sciences (Economics, Psychology, Sociologyâ€¦)
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis.
Creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently
Nice-to-haves
Experience in a mobile B2C business.
Experience implementing data science models with Python or R.
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn't stopped us from offering these great benefits!
You'll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with, along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance, just in case!
Generous meal vouchers!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser's for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
"An apple a day keeps the doctor away" so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You're welcome on the team no matter where you're from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It's a trick question â€“ mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Were you always interested in detectives? Curious about how it works and how to prevent it maybe? Well, now you can! Fourthline is looking for CDD analysts that help us find online financial crime within the realm of KYC (know your customer) and Due Diligence checks.

This is a great job for you if ...
… You love it when everything is 100% correct! That the details can be checked off in every customer case and that we as Fourthline continue to provide a very high-quality service! Become a superhero and help us track down criminals ...!

How do you become that hero?
We advise you to start with a superhero name, that is already difficult! But when you start working with us, you will quickly immerse yourself in all the characteristics that have to do with KYC. What is Fraud? How does it work? And what do we as Fourthline pay attention to ensure that we are dealing with "honest people" or "fraudsters". But you also have a signaling position because crime never stops and is becoming more sophisticated and refined by the day. In bullet points (or check boxes):
KYC checks on the many incoming cases
Detect and investigate fraudulent filings with large corporations and banks
You will report to the Team Lead of the CDD team.

Job Title: 2022 Corporate & Investment Bank Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship January - June (Madrid)
Job Description:
What to expect
Our Off-Cycle Analyst Program runs for six months from January to June. We will give you relevant support and training, arming you with technical and practical skills that will help you hit the ground running.
You'll make an impact by:

Analysing market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations for mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and capital markets advisory.
Managing client transactions from pitch to close under the guidance of our senior leaders.
Coming up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges.
Learning how we help clients and communities grow, no matter their needs.
Sharpening your technical skills.
Building your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others.
The program is an opportunity to take your career to the next level through hands-on experience, relevant skills training and valuable professional networking.
About You
If you've got initiative and the vision to come up with strategies and plans, then this is the role for you.
Key skills and eligibility criteria include:

Excellent analytical, quantitative and interpretative skills
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative work environment
Being adaptable, flexible and resilient
Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Fluency in English and Spanish is a prerequisite.
You must be a recent graduate, eligible to start full-time by the end of 2021. If you plan to pursue further education beyond your undergraduate studies, please ensure this is accurately reflected in the graduation date entered on your application.
A well-rounded academic background is important - being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in your undergraduate studies is preferred. You certainly don't need a degree in Economics or Finance, but a good level of numeracy is required.
But beyond that, what we're most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
What's next?
Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
To start the application, you will be prompted to enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile so make sure it is one you will have long term access to. Do not use an email address with ".edu" extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.
After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.
You'll receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
HireVue is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this required element as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

As a Finance Analyst you will develop strong relationships with all assigned business partners and EMEA markets while maintaining an objective mind in evaluating their performance as a group.

In this role, you will…

Design and develop new reports and reporting capability using Business Objects BI reporting tool.
Participate in monthly closing activities and prepare Actual vs. Budget/Forecast analysis reporting pack for management on monthly & quarterly basis.

Enter financial data to Financial Planning system.

Identify, diagnose, and resolve technical problems, escalate and track problems appropriately and provide guidance on alternative solutions on any issues identified by working closely with the Business Intelligence team.
Support the implementation of Global Corporate Policies as well as Accounting Treatment changes and US GAAP reporting. Identify accounting issues and assist in their resolution.
Prepare Journal Entries for accruals posting in ERP systems and perform accounts reconciliation.
Participate in finance related projects, particularly those related to ERP/systems transitions (for example, SAP)
Actively propose and participate in the process and system automation improvements.

In this role, you’ll need …

3-5 years of relevant Finance experience
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field or equivalent experience
Good knowledge of US and Local Spanish GAAPs
Good communications Communication and presentation skills
Ability to work on complex issues and perform in-depth evaluations and knowledge of layout and design best practices for reports and dashboards
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills
Problem solver, system and detailed oriented with strong analytical skills, especially dealing with large volumes of data without sacrificing on accuracy
Advanced Excel skills essential and systems experience such as SAP, Business Objects BI reporting, Planning systems (Host Analytics) and data visualization tools
Analytical mindset and numerical capabilities allowing for proactive resolution of problems raised by business users
Fluent Spanish and English
Ability to travel abroad up to 10% of the time for training and internal meeting purposes

Job Description Summary
The role of the Business Partner Analyst, SMART Factory Process Data Management is to serve as the thought leader responsible for Process Data collection solutions for manufacturing, responsible for analyzing demand and the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for Manufacturing Execution Systems, globally.

This role is responsible for driving and shaping demand as well as ensuring the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the digitalization of manufacturing records, and SMART Factory functions, globally.

This individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that business priorities are shaped, prioritized, and delivered. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together as they contribute to the production execution and MES agenda and Smart Factory deployment

This position reports directly to the Lead Business Partner, MES.
Job Description
The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business operations and engineering teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD’s Production & SMART factory environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Establishing value-adding, strategic partner relationships for themselves and for the entire TGS function
Partner with the Manufacturing SMEs and Engineering teams to plan new joint initiatives, evaluate proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Manage and facilitate TGS’ partner teams to ensure delivery provides the desired outcomes
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS’ Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD’s enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in SMART factory technologies and processes in emerging technology, as well as improvements to existing investments, by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Consult with and support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing analytics capability.
Provide support for site manufacturing and engineering related activities including master data, transaction processing, and data interface between MES and Control Systems working with worldwide and local engineering, operations, continuous improvement and plant IT teams.
Measure and communicate value realized on a periodic basis through defined and agreed upon metrics and supporting analysis.
Serve as a continuous connector. Energized by a role that is focused on partnership and facilitation. Operates through the lens of what can we do to simplify and improve things.
Working with our IT partners to coordinate MES functional support and resolution of critical tickets.
Understand and leverage the Idea to Realization (I2R) process for IT solution delivery including demand management, change control, project management, software validation and the whole System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Foster and maintain a network of MES subject matter experts across BD within plants and WW business units.
Train, coach and support plant associates implementing the standard MES solutions, working with them to plan, schedule, and execute MES implementations and upgrades.
Work with IT and Security teams to ensure system implementations are compliant to latest standards and policies for secure industrial networked systems.
Understand sites use of SAP and other ERPs related to manufacturing, and integration with MES.
Identify opportunities to leverage technology to reduce the burden of manual entry of data.
Must be willing to travel in US and internationally.
QUALIFICATIONS:
The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together. In addition, this person should also possess:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Accomplished in multiple process and technology capabilities across the Manufacturing, Quality and Plant Maintenance functions, ideally in the Med device sector.
Experience in Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES): Machine Data Collection, Inventory Management, and Production Order Processing.
Strong technical skills related to the technology utilized by the MES Team. Understands OPC, HMIs, Computer networks, Relational Databases, Server and PC Operating Systems. Industrial networking and connectivity to PLCs for data collection, VLANs, Firewalls.
Knowledge of ERPs and usage in manufacturing, production planning, execution, and materials management as it relates to SAP or other ERPs.
Project Management experience that includes large IT related projects where people and hardware resources were successfully managed.
Knowledge of FDA 21CFR Part 11, understanding of System Development Life Cycle and software validation procedures: IQ, OQ, PQ
Ability to troubleshoot, analyzing problems, and offer intelligent insight and solutions.
Ability to map joint organizational vision and long-term thinking, imagination, and idea generation
Ability to communicate complex business / technical challenges in a simplified manner
Must be a leader who can influence stakeholders in written and oral communications
Must have experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies and can formulate new programs to generate excitement and engagement
Familiarity with continuous improvement and project management approaches, tools, and phases
Exceptional ability to lead change using positive and collaborative methods
Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity
Leading by example, mentoring, and motivating others all around you
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Excellent judgment and decision-making
Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
Accepts ownership
Ability/experience to work in a multinational, multicultural business environment
Core Competencies: Process effectiveness, Innovation, Continuous and versatile learning, Teamwork, Influencing others
Other Desirable Skills/Experience:
7+ years experience working in a highly automated manufacturing environment
PLC software development experience.
Microsoft Office Suite
Programming skills in some of the following; SQL, JavaScript; .Net, HTML & XML are a plus
Understanding of databases, big data technologies, and analytic tools
Primary Work Location
ESP Barcelona

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.
And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning.
Welcome to SITA
SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.
We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Identify link earning activities: research potential partnership opportunities, brainstorm PR story ideas, and conduct blogger outreach to build external relationships
Strategize ways to build more external connections and partnerships to further boost Vistaprint’s authority

Being at Vistaprint means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so and when in-person collaboration will deliver the best results. As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint creates customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. With Vistaprint, small businesses are able to create and customize their marketing with easy-to-use digital tools and design-templates, or by receiving expert graphic design support. In 2020, Vistaprint acquired 99designs to expand its design offering via a worldwide community of more than 150,000 talented designers to make it easy for designers and clients to work together to create designs they love. Vistaprint is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

Madbox is a mobile gaming company, creating and publishing its own games worldwide. After two years of existence, Madbox has gathered more than 100 million players, still growing. We are looking for top talents with mad skills, a mad passion and a mad ambition to join us.

Madbox is looking for a passionate, experienced Game Data Analyst willing to build new top models of data analytics to enable the company to keep improving its games.
Based in Barcelona, you will have the opportunity to work with the Head of Data, the Product Manager and the game teams to keep delivering high-end Analytics solutions and business insights to the company.
We live in a flat-structured creative environment where ownership and accountability are our two mantras. We look for high-energy individuals ready to bring Madbox to a global stage.
What will you do ?
Working closely with the Game Leads, Head of Data and Product Managers to lead the product analysis of our games and players and keep developing our game analytics tools.
Daily conversations with the production team to define the key metrics of success to be tracked in every game and the different A/B testings that should be performed.
Proactive analysis of the performance of our games: explain their performance and provide insights about how to improve the games.
Define events tracking required for the analysis.
Data crunching and dashboards building, both on demand and at your own initiative.
Managing the production analytics work plan together with the head of data.
Mad Skills

Knowledge and proven experience in game analytics (preferably mobile), including knowledge about the KPIs used in the video game and advertising industries.
Experience with Data visualisation tools (preferably Looker).
Proven experience with SQL.
B.Sc. in Engineering. (Nice to have: MSc.).

Autonomy and ability to take decisions and make projects move forward while keeping transparency and continuous updates to relevant stakeholders

The Madbox Mindset
True passion for making beautiful games
Ability to question ourselves and self-reflect on our achievements and successes/failures
High level of intensity and everything we do to reach our ambitions
Mixing both candor and care in order to constantly share constructive feedback
You are a humble yet ultra ambitious individual
You are a team player and a game maker at heart
You are T-shaped and enjoy small structures where everyone has a strong impact
You want to learn and grow in a passionate environment

Team profit sharing

Round Hill Capital is currently looking to fill a Senior Analyst position within its investments team in Madrid, covering investment opportunities and strategies across Southern Europe, with the key focus on Spain and Portugal. RHC operates a flat organizational structure, so Analysts will have great exposure across the various operating functions of the business as well as with senior team members, both domestic and internationally.
Your role will be key in the underwriting and analysis of potential Real Estate investment opportunities in Residential, Student, Senior Living and Hospitality asset classes. An Analyst in this role will be directly exposed to all of the stages of the investment process, including research, sourcing, underwriting, structuring, due diligence, execution, asset management and, sporadically, supporting in fundraising.
The Role
Carry out in-depth market research: retrieving, analysing and interpreting data both from public and private sources without a need for guidance nor supervision
Suggest solid investment strategies as a result of thorough market analysis, being able to think in a critical and creative manner
Develop from scratch, and manage, financial models and asset specific business plans: levered, post tax
Present internally compelling investment opportunities, being able to demonstrate solid market fundamentals, strong financials and well thought-through risk management
Manage external advisors and counterparties
Assisting in the ongoing portfolio enhancement of existing investments.
The Candidate
Prospective Analysts are driven individuals with 1-3 years of working experience in a relevant position in Real Estate investment firms or investment banks. The ideal candidate must be willing to work in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment. In addition, the candidate will need to possess the following:
Excellent modelling and scenario analysis skills. Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) as a must
Ability to think in both a critical and creative way
Entrepreneurial spirit and capacity to work without constant supervision
Minimum 1 year experience underwriting alternative asset classes. Prior experience underwriting both equity and debt investments as a plus
Excellent written and oral communication skills in both Spanish and English. Valuable: Portuguese or Italian
No agencies please

We’re Fever!
Fever is the leading global entertainment discovery platform, and has revolutionised the world of entertainment since 2015, inspiring over 45 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities. Fever empowers event organizers to create amazing experiences, with successful examples such as the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 1 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience”, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party” in multiple cities across the world.
Fever is an international company with a team of over 350 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid and Barcelona, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, Fidelity and Atresmedia among others.
What do we do?
Fever’s marketplace is composed of events and experiences hosted by organizers that we provide visibility to via our marketplace and media network.
However, given that Fever and our Secret Media Network provide us with millions of data points and insights around how people consume offline entertainment, we are now able to go one step further in the value chain and create our own “Fever Originals” experiences. We believe there is a huge opportunity to create more of our own content, and continue to provide an amazing content offering to our users!
THE ROLE
You’ll be part of the engineering team and you will be responsible for the improvement of our Data Warehouse working with the latest Big Data technologies
You’ll be working helping other teams to make automations that create amazing business opportunities, surrounded by highly qualified professionals like you in a highly scalable and performance way
On your first month in Fever:
You will be fully integrated into the team. During this month you will have already participated in onboardings, pair programming, one to one, Scrum sessions, and you will have met the departments of Fever
You will get familiar with Fever’s tech stack and frameworks used to develop our data strategy
You will attend some of the Fever Original’s experiences like Candlelight
After 3 months in Fever:
You’ll be able to come up with solutions to new difficult problems and your developments will be creating new business opportunities
You’ll have responsibilities over develop our Data Warehouse
You will participate in some of the hackdays or hackathons we organise with other teams, and you will mostly know everybody from engineering
On your 6th month in Fever:
You’ll improve performance, scalability and infrastructure of data projects
You’ll be mentoring other new joiners to the team
You will participate in some of the team buildings we organise for your team or the whole engineering team
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve data to our organisation for helping to get the best decisions based on data
Create, improve or migrate processes for our Data Warehouse
Have a business-oriented mindset and create business automatization for different teams to create huge business opportunities
Understand the technical trade offs of different solutions, implement them and make them scalable
BASIC SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS
You’re smart, get stuff done, have great energy, and thrive in a fast paced environment
You know and master Data Warehousing processes and best practices
Deep knowledge on Python3 (Pandas, Pyspark), Snowflake, Postgresql, AWS (S3, EC2, RDS, Aurora) Airflow and Docker.
You have the ability to work with tons of APIs
You comply with defined coding standards, creating quality code. You can't think of a code without tests
You are proficient in business English
It would be a plus if you...
You have worked in a multidisciplinary team working with roles such as data-engineer, data-analyst, data-scientist, data-ops, marketing or product.
You have worked with the API of most popular marketing tools (Facebook, Google, Instagram, etc.)
BENEFITS AND PERKS
Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance.
Stock Options
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of Madrid, with possible travel across our markets
Home office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee.
English Lessons
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

At TomTom…
You’ll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow’s mobility for the better.
We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.
We are looking for an enthusiastic professional to join our Maps Analytics team in Madrid! As Business Analyst with big expertise on visualization, you will help to drive our map development strategy with the insights you generate, and transforming data to help us upgrade our maps for our end-customers!

What you’ll do
Visualization of metrics, creating dashboards to help to make location content best-in-class by advocating for and implementing changes to technology, process, tools, and systems.
Draw our strategy based on insights obtained by manipulating data from a huge variety of sources: system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources and from multiple databases mainly in cloud (Azure/AWS)
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy
Collaborate with teams to bring synergy, with tools a communications channels that ensure transparency and knowledge sharing cross the company
Dedicate part of your weekly schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments, …
Work in a mostly-remote and flexible way that will allow you find the perfect work-life balance
What you’ll need
Bachelor’s/Masters/PHD in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field
Minimum 2-3 Years of experience working as a Data Scientist specialized on dashboard creation and metric visualizations
Good communications skills in English
Good at data Storytelling
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.
A drive to learn new technologies
Strong problem-solving skills
Experience Reporting and dashboarding tools: PowerBI, Tableau, R Shiny, Dash, …
Experience in slicing and dicing of large data sets to draw insights
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments
What’s nice to have
Knowledge and experience with using GIS tools for spatial data analysis.
Knowledge and experience on Webscrapping (e.g., scrapy, selenium)
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
Strong level of proficiency in Python, Unix/Linux, and SQL
Experience working with Big Data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Presto, S3).
Meet your team
We’re PU Maps Analytics, an unit from Maps Product Units.
Part of TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit, the Maps product unit is comprised of over 2,000 people in 40 countries – all driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for the hundreds of millions of people using TomTom maps around the world. Joining this product unit, you can help continuously innovate our map-making processes, create a real-time closed loop between detected changes in the real world and the users’ map, and build maps that will enable the future of autonomous driving.
Within Maps product unit, the Maps Analytics team is focused on creating efficient ways to state our map quality and drive insights to the map production teams that help the company evolve in a smart way.
On our team, you’ll see your work is used to take strategic decision and improve operations.

Achieve more
We are self-starters who play well with others. Every day, we solve new problems with creativity, meet new people and learn rapidly at our offices around the world. We will invest in your growth and are committed to supporting you. In everything we do, we’re guided by six values: We care, putting our heart into what we do; we build trust (you can count on us); we create – driven to make a difference; we are confident, but don’t boast; we keep it simple, since life is complex enough; and we have fun because life’s too short to be boring.

After you apply
Your Manager and onboarding team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout the process, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews through your onboarding.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Knowledge Analyst (KA) within BCG's Social Impact Practice Area, you will work in a fast growing and entrepreneurial global team, providing expertise and insights for the Total Societal Impact (TSI)/Sustainability topic including but not limited to ESG data & analytics, sustainability ambition and target setting, sustainability strategy development, materiality assessments, SDG analytics or sustainability peer benchmarking, working together with BCG case and proposal teams to deliver customized knowledge assets and expert advisory.

In addition, you will support with guidance from senior colleagues, your TSI/Sustainability topic in developing intellectual property & knowledge assets and managing content on internal BCG websites, ensuring availability of latest, high-quality content. You will also support business development and go-to-market efforts of the TSI/Sustainability topic, as opportunities arise, contributing research and analysis to marketing efforts.
Social Impact is BCG’s newest practice area and a driving force for BCG's ambition to become the most positively impactful company in the world. We believe that we can transform how business creates good competitive advantage, and that we can help profitably solve some of society’s most pressing problems together with our clients.
BCG has a heritage and a commitment to Social Impact working at the intersection of private, public and social sectors. We have impact in the world across 6 areas: TSI/Sustainability, Sustainable Finance & Investing, Climate & Environment, Global Development, Global Health, and Education. BCG has with Total Societal Impact/Sustainability a topic at the heart of the commercial agenda with private sector companies. We have a differentiated perspective in the market on Total Societal Impact (TSI) - a company’s economic, social, and environmental effects on the world - and can demonstrate that TSI has also a positive impact on total shareholder return (TSR). We target delivering TSI Transformations spanning a company’s products and services, business operations, and supply chains. We also aspire to imbed a TSI lens in all of BCG’s work. You can find more about BCG's own sustainability ambition In BCG's latest sustainability report Progress in a Year of Adversity 2020
YOU'RE GOOD AT
Applying TSI/Sustainability, sustainability strategy and/or ESG data & analytics expertise when contributing to building and deploying TSI/Sustainability's products, tools, and data, taking different client contexts into account
Working collaboratively and effectively in a very dynamic often virtual environment, proficient in agile ways of working
Communicating with senior stakeholders, being credible and proactive
Framing, structuring, and sharing intellectual property, with the ability to write clearly and concisely
Working creatively and analytically in a time-limited, problem-solving environment
Flexibility and bring a curious, entrepreneurial and creative mindset, open for new things and able to propose innovative ideas that help our clients
Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity In a fast-paced environment
Interacting with internal and external stakeholders while working in a global collaborative team environment
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
1-2 years of relevant work experience required in the area of corporate sustainability, sustainability management and/or ESG data & analytics with proven user experience on ESG data provider platforms; candidates with consulting experience preferred
Bachelor’s degree required in relevant fields; advanced degree preferred
Strong analytical capabilities, e.g., versatile In xls, Alteryx and Tableau with proven ability to build consistent models and user-friendly client-ready dashboards
Knowledge and familiarity with broader sustainability domain e.g., Climate & Environment, Sustainable Finance, Diversity & Inclusion, biodiversity, water, CSR/citizenship, ESG, materiality, SDGs, SASB, stakeholder engagement; knowledge on the Circular Economy topic preferred
Fluency in English
YOU'LL WORK WITH
As a Knowledge Analyst you will collaborate with global topic leads, managers and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.

Madrid

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.
BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.
WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world. Knowledge@BCG consists of the Knowledge Team (KT), Data & Research Services (DRS) and Knowledge & Collaboration Solution (KCS). KT is a group of experts within respective fields or areas providing industry, functional and geographic expertise to consulting teams. KT members are aligned to Practice Areas, sometimes serving as members of case or project teams. KT offers insight into a topic or function derived from BCG’s knowledge base and case/project experience. The members of our DRS team work alongside consulting team colleagues to bring advanced research capabilities to support projects and clients. KCS team is a cross-functional team equipping BCGers with internal and external knowledge resources and digital collaboration tools, enabling them to work smarter and with increased productivity

Job Title: Finance Analyst, Costing, Pricing & Control CHEP Pallets
Job Description:
Les sociétés de Brambles, dont CHEP, aident à distribuer plus de marchandises à plus de personnes et sur plus de sites que n'importe quelle autre organisation dans le monde. Nos 330 millions de palettes, caisses et conteneurs sont continuellement en mouvement et constituent l'épine dorsale invisible de la chaîne d’approvisionnement mondiale, et les plus grandes marques nous font confiance pour les aider à transporter leurs marchandises de manière plus efficace, durable et sûre. En tant que pionnier de l'économie du partage, Brambles a créé l'une des entreprises de logistique les plus durables qui soient en s'appuyant sur le partage et la réutilisation de ses plateformes selon un modèle appelé « location-gestion ». Brambles dessert principalement les secteurs des biens de grande consommation (produits alimentaires secs, épicerie et produits de santé et de soins personnels), des fruits et légumes frais, des boissons, de la vente au détail et de la fabrication générale. Le Groupe emploie plus 10.000 personnes et est présent dans plus de 60 pays, avec ses opérations principales en Amérique du Nord et en Europe occidentale. Pour de plus amples informations, consultez le site www.brambles.com. Brambles et CHEP vous offrent des occasions incomparables pour faire progresser votre carrière. Vous rejoindrez une organisation internationale en croissance ayant un modèle d’affaires circulaire pionnier. Vous travaillerez pour une entreprise qui transforme la mise en marché des produits. Vous ferez partie d’une équipe mondiale efficace et fondée sur la collaboration et vous contribuerez ainsi réellement au développement d’une approche plus intelligente et plus durable pour notre avenir à tous. Pour en savoir plus sur la manière dont les sociétés en croissance de Brambles peuvent accélérer votre évolution professionnelle, visitez https://careers.brambles.com/
Description de poste
LanguagWorking in collaboration with our partners in Strategic Marketing, Pricing Strategy and local business teams this role will support in delivering our vision for CHEP Europe of a customer segmented pricing strategy to create opportunities for Growth, Retention & Margin Maximisation in conjunction with local business and their go to market strategies. Segmented costing will be a key area of focus for this role.
Major/ Key Accountabilities:
Collaborate with strategic marketing and pricing strategy teams to deliver key strategic programs on Price and Cost segmentation.
Develop and implement a segmented costing analytics aligned with the business needs.
Engage with business SMEs in commercial facing teams to understand customers attributes driving Cost.
Drive the delivery of commercial decision support output, guiding the organization in Commercial Finance and Pricing Activities, including contract renewals and finance evaluation of new opportunities.
Effectively manage and interrogate complex costing and pricing related data sets; assume responsibility for accuracy and validity of outputs through understanding aim and purpose of investigations, ensuring repeatability and reproducibility of data captured.
Build and test costing hypothesis through data, encompassing segmentation factors beyond Sector (Size, Automation, Weight, Retailer, Service Offer).
Support the design of field experiment to enhance desk-based analysis and hypothesis to leverage local learning and extrapolation to the EU costing segmentation.
Costing control, adapting, and evolving the segmented cost models to business needs
Support cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of pricing initiatives.
Perform ad hoc investigation, projects, and analyses to support various business needs and strategies, presenting results in a clear and actionable manner
Experience:
2+ years of Finance experience preferably for complex multinational businesses, with Commercial and Supply Chain Finance and Pricing expertise
Skills & Knowledge:
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Established financial, commercial, and strategic analysis skills.
Excellent data management skills.
Base level financial modelling skills (DCF Analysis, scenario analysis, business case development, business valuations, and operational modelling).
Commercial acumen with demonstrated strength in solving both structured and unstructured problems.
Advanced Word / Excel / PowerPoint skills.
Exceptional interpersonal skills to enable the effective management of stakeholders.
Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively to deadlines and without supervision.
Languages: English
Éducation préférée
Qualified Professional and Equivalent. Basic (5 years)
Niveau d'expérience de travail préféré
3 - 5 years
