We’re Fever!
Fever is the leading global entertainment discovery platform and has revolutionised the world of entertainment since 2015, inspiring over 45 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities. Fever empowers event organizers to create amazing experiences, with successful examples such as the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 1 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience”, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party” in multiple cities across the world.
Fever is a US company with a team of over 550 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid, and Barcelona, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, Fidelity, and Atresmedia among others.

What do we do?
Fever’s marketplace is composed of events and experiences hosted by organizers that we provide visibility to via our marketplace and media network.
However, given that Fever and our Secret Media Network provide us with millions of data points and insights around how people consume offline entertainment, we are now able to go one step further in the value chain and create our own “Fever Originals” experiences, similar to how Netflix has begun to create their own shows. We believe there is a huge opportunity to create more of our own content, and continue to provide an amazing content offering to our users!

About the role
Guide the growth of our media team using a mix of data analysis, visualization and process automation.
Analyze our performance across social media and help grow and develop our Secret Media Network
Optimize our media strategy.
Create new communication and workflow channels and tools between departments.
Automate and develop the marketing department processes focused on our digital channels.
About You
You're a bilingual English speaker.
You’re an engineer (Civil, Industrial, Telecommunications or Aeronautics) or have Maths/Statistics background.
0-2 year's experience in an analytics role.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to work successfully across many disciplines.
Digital marketing background experience in social paid platforms is a plus.
Fluent in SQL and experienced in data visualization
Passion for content, social media and online culture
Benefits
Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance.
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of Madrid, with possible travel across our markets
Home office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee.
English Lessons
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow

Job Title: Continuous Improvement, Lean and Quality Analyst
Job Description:
The role incumbent is responsible for identifying, planning and delivering improvement initiatives and projects that change the way we work to create a more efficient business and processes.

Under the responsibility of the Continuous Improvement, Lean and Quality Manager, you will work on continuous improvement topics and contribute to building a Lean culture in the business unit, as well as establishing quality control and quality assessment processes, in order to drive the overall Business unit performance.

The perfect candidate should become the “swiss knife” of the business unit, able to understand and learn quickly processes, data structure, able to jump into a large number of different topics.

Who you will work with

You will be reporting to the Continuous Improvement, Lean and Quality Manager, and will be working with a number of internal and external stakeholders, including but not limited to: Underwriting, Operations, Legal, Human Resources, Finance, Brokers.

What you will be responsible for

You will be responsible for analysing improvement opportunities in a complex and multi-dimensional environments. For that purpose, you will be reviewing large quantitative and qualitative indicators and sources of information, to help the leadership team and your Manager make informed decisions. You will be presenting complexity and diversity of data, in a coherent and structured way. You will create and execute business transformation plans contributing to Chubb’s Day to Day efficiency and taking ownership for various work streams that support that strategy.

What you will do and key responsibilities:
Continuous improvement and Lean:
Establishment of operational procedures, processes and controls for the business unit.

Contribute to building a Lean Culture and processes.

Contribute to process improvement and standardisation.

Identify, Analyse, make recommendation for continuous improvement initiatives.

Achieve stakeholder buy-in, delivering projects within agreed timescales.

Deliver change, communication and training plans as appropriate.

Continually assess effectiveness and efficiency of current business processes and resource allocations.

Generate ideas for process and technology improvements within and across businesses and implements change. Focus on improved productivity and consistent service delivery. Regularly report on the various intiatives and metrics.

Strategic Piloting:
Build and maintain performance metrics and define in conjunction with the business unit head a performance dashboard.

Regularly report on business performance through diverse metrics, some of which need you will create.

Quality:
Identify opportunities for data enrichment, data quality enhancement, service level enhancement.

Build and monitor Quality control and quality assessment processes for the business unit.

Maintain quality indicators and report regularly on these indicators.

As part of this role, you may have to contribute to improvement workshops and seminars for internal clients and external brokers. As part of this role, you will be interacting with varying levels of seniority, from underwriters to senior Leadership members, requiring you to be adaptable, able to synthetize as well as to go into the details of the process. The role may interact with Brokers at senior level.

The role may require some international travel in the future.
Qualifications

Your career experience so far

The role incumbent is likely to have worked in a professional services environment where they would have been involved in business transformation/process improvement training and projects.

Prior experience in process improvement is a plus.

Ability to manage and deal with large amount of data, structured or unstructured is a plus.

Business analyst and business analytics experience is important.

Experience in working in a highly matrixed environment is preferable.

Experience with Commercial insurance underwriting is a plus.

Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel.

Experience in automatizing small repetitive tasks is a plus.

It is desirable that the role incumbent possess the following key skills for this role:

Ability to work in a fast paced and moving environment.

Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt.

The post holder should be able to demonstrate a consistent level of skill at an appropriate level and a breadth of experience across projects of different sizes.

Super strong Excel skills (your friends, family and colleagues generally call you for any issue with excel or their computer). Experience in building robust macros and coding in VBA strongly preferred. Coding experience C# or C++, or other languages is a plus.

Strong Office suit of application experience, including MS visio and Powerpoint is strongly preferred.

Experience in creating, managing databases is a plus.

Fluency in English, both verbal and written. Ability to present and communicate complex concepts, simply.

Ability to speak an additional European language among French, Dutch, German, Italian is a plus.

Strong self-organisational skills are required.

Junior Data Scientist (f/m)
100% | Madrid
This is a unique opportunity for an open-minded person, fascinated by latest ML and AI developments but who just as much likes to get things done with real implications and observe the theories applied in the energy trading environment. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will translate the business needs to advanced mathematical models and create state of the art but yet pragmatic solutions, exploiting the available data to enhance trading decisions and profit generation.
Join us, be part and collaborate actively with the company wide community of Advanced Analytics!
What you will do
Applying best-practice data science to implement Big Data and advanced analytics use-cases across BA T&S
Leverage state of the art machine learning, optimization and simulation techniques to maximize business impact of use cases
Enhancing existing modelling strategies and ensure state of-the-art algorithms
Leverage required skills across BA T&S
Supporting the evaluation and integration of key initiatives for the implementation of Axpo's Advanced Analytics Strategy

What you bring & who you are
Master's degree in Data Science or equivalent experience
First experiences in data driven model development and deployment
Knowledge and interest of machine learning algorithms and ability to apply them in data driven trading systems
First experience in articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data
Excellent skills in Python, using query languages such as SQL
Fluency in English
What we offer
Lifelong learning
Get off to a flying start with the induction programme at the Axpo Academy. And don't stop there: we offer a wide range of courses and training, including flexible e-learning. Benefit from time and financial support on your learning and development journey, and take advantage of initiatives like 'Lunch & Learn, individual development plans, coaching and talent management.
Your choice
Flexibility comes in many forms. How about an annualised hours model, part-time position (even for managers) or the freedom to choose when and where you work? Axpo offers all these as well as the chance to buy additional vacation days if you need them.
You're covered
Investing in your future starts now. Axpo pays generous employer contributions to the pension fund. If you get sick, we'll cover your salary in full for up to two years. And because safety's a priority, we offer private accident insurance for everyone as well as reduced premiums for health insurance.
The whole package
As a market leader in our field, we offer competitive salaries across Axpo including a variable compensation component. Important to us is our commitment to equal pay for equal work.
About us
Axpo Iberia, a subsidiary of the Axpo Group, was established in Spain in 2002 and manages the most important independent portfolio of renewable energies on the Iberian Peninsula. We offer our customers in Spain and Portugal products and services in the fields of energy and gas supply, energy management for producers of renewable energies and heat and power cogeneration, as well as trading of raw materials, biomass and CO2. Axpo is Switzerland's largest producer of renewable energy, as well as an international leader in energy trading and the marketing of solar and wind power. At its headquarters in Switzerland and in 30 countries across Europe as well as the US, around 5,000 employees use state-of-the-art technology to develop sustainable, innovative energy solutions.
More information
About the team
Axpo Solutions has decided to accelerate the Advanced Analytics transformation and the wider deployment of model-based trading across the different commodity desks and countries.
For such a goal, the Advanced Analytics team has been created as a center of excellence for the adoption of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science across the whole company. You will be part of an international team sitting between Madrid and Baden (Switzerland) that focuses on end-to-end implementation of high impact use cases across Europe and commodity desks.
As such, we also maintain a regular contact with teams of traders, quantitative analysts as well as the management, who is a strong supporter of the ML-based trading approach.
Contact
Luca Brugnano
Talent Acquisition Expert

Senior Data Scientist (f/m)
100% | Madrid
This is a unique opportunity for an open-minded person, fascinated by latest ML and AI developments but who just as much likes to get things done with real implications and observe the theories applied in the energy trading environment. Design, develop and operate advanced analytics trading-related use cases across a cloud-based environment

Interact with trading desks on a regular basis to directly support profit generation with your models
Perform exploratory analysis on new use cases, prototype solutions and present results to stakeholders
Contribute to the internal promotion of Advanced Analytics to business stake-holders
Shape and develop the Advanced Analytics use case portfolio on a pan-European level
Conduct research activities in areas such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a focus on finding practical applications for our use case portfolio

What you bring & who you are
Proven track record in data driven model development and deployment (>3-5 years of experience), ideally in energy/commodity trading
In-depth knowledge of machine learning algorithms, time series analysis, and ability to apply them in data driven trading systems
Experience articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data
Strong conceptual skills and able to interact with different audiences at different abstraction lev-els to democratize Advanced Analytics and their use in trading
Highly proficient in Python and query languages such as SQL
Proficient in English

Job Title: Data Engineer (also available for full remote working)
Job Description:
Company Description

Launched in 1998, this pioneering British-born brand has specialised in creating amazing experiences and unforgettable memories - from hotels, city breaks and holidays to theatre, entertainment and spa days. Experts in brightening up online travel, lastminute.com is among the worldwide leaders in the field, helping hundreds of thousands of customers every year find, and do, "whatever makes them pink".
lastminute.com is part of lm group, publicly traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry. Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services

Job Description

*Please note that this can be a full remote working position*
lastminute.com is looking for a Data Engineer for its Data & Analytics department team based in Chiasso.
The candidate will act within Data & Analytics department perimeters supporting, inspiring and delivering data integrations, data models, analysis, reports and dashboards to help the business look data in a comprehensive way, take proper decisions and steer directions of the units.
Key Responsibilities
Design, development and continuous improvements of end-to-end data pipelines in all environments (Big Data & DWH) supporting/taking specification from business stakeholders and Data Analysts
Continuous improvement in delivery, applying engineering best practices to development, monitoring, and data quality of the data pipelines.
Data model creation, design of ETL activities and unit tests
Writing documents for mapping of data flows according to business rule

Qualifications

Essential
2-5 years of experience in similar role in a fast-paced environment
Advanced SQL language knowledge and programming languages (e.g. Java, Python)
Strong knowledge of distributed file system techniques (e.g.: HDFS cluster)
Expertise with transactional, analytical and NoSQL DBs
Demonstrable ability to work creatively and analytically with a strong attitude for problem solving
Experience in Cloud environments (e.g.: GCP, AWS)
Fluent in English both written and spoken
Desirable
Bachelor or master degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics
Understand stakeholders business areas and take ownership of their data need, collect/support business requirement definition - be able to influence and partner with them leveraging on an in-depth cross-functional data knowledge
Performing analysis with the aim of providing insights and summaries to direct manager, the rest of the team and other functions
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques
Knowledge of Big Data programming languages (e.g.: Spark and Scala)
Good knowledge of Google Work Suite

Additional Information

Abilities/qualities
Analytical and data driven mindset: improve the business providing insights coming from data
Passionate about digital world, ambitious and motivated with a can-do attitude
Open minded and proactiveness in problem solving
Good communication skills with a willingness to challenge existing processes and applications
Strong team player and excellent communicator
Good interpersonal, communication and presentation skills

For TUI Group IT we are looking for a Business Analyst (m/f/d) with immediate effect.

In the WholeSale team we are looking for a Business Analyst (m/f/d) to take responsibility for and further develop our applications in the area of accommodation purchasing, search and book requests.

To ensure that TUI can put a smile on the faces of its guests day after day, the IT of the world's leading tourism group ensures smooth processes. With a great deal of passion for technology and expertise, TUI Infotec is driving the digital transformation forward. Innovative solutions are created for customers and guests by bringing together the right people and appropriate technologies. Know-how and fun with digitalization, reliability, uniqueness, and an open approach to new with new technologies are what make the company stand out. Flexibility is a top priority - TUI Infotec offers an agile, dynamic environment that is characterized by the search for new ideas and the corresponding willingness to change.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
In the role of Business Analyst (m/f/d) in the area of Accommodation and Sourcing, you will be the internal consulting interface between business and cross-country stakeholders, focusing on the creation, conceptualization and implementation support of technical specifications of the underlying IT processes related to purchased hotels and the support of the created systems. Together with the team, you will design, develop and support viable and future-proof applications and put them into action in sprints. As an agile and powerful team, we feel end-to-end responsibility for the product and ensure smooth operations in addition to further development. Specifically, your tasks include:

You are the technical/professional contact person for our functional product teams
You design, create and support technical concepts for the further development of the hotel purchasing system and other relevant partner portals and ensure its continuous improvement by analyzing and correcting errors
You create concepts for workflows and process chains in order to automate recurring tasks as much as possible
You are responsible for the creation and conception of automated solutions to support and optimize support and decision processes
You sort and prioritize topics arising in day-to-day business on your own responsibility in coordination with the product owner
You check the developments in close exchange with the developers and ensure the go-live, as well as the configurations including documentation and tests.

We encourage people with disabilities to apply.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
Degree in business or technical field or similar qualification or tourism education/study with several years of technical experience.
Experience working as a business analyst, in connection with external suppliers or several years of practical applied knowledge in agile methods
Sound technical understanding, knowledge of software development, various interface technologies (REST, SOAP, etc.), as well as knowledge in their effort estimation
Deep understanding and in-depth knowledge of industry standard data transfer formats (EDF, OTDS, AIF, etc.) or strong IT knowledge in data structures with interest in learning these data formats
Goal-oriented analytical, comprehension, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Self-motivation and commitment, as well as independence and sense of responsibility towards team, customer and product
Communication and conflict management skills in fluent German and very good English
Sound knowledge of tourism processes, especially hotel purchasing desirable

TUI AND YOU
Competitive salary
Pension scheme, life assurance and options to buy shares
Generous holiday entitlement & holiday discounts
Forward thinking ways of working
TUI time off, purchase of additional holiday entitlement
Excellent rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers

TUI Group’s vision is to make travel experiences special. To fulfil this vision, we never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.

At TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to. Just as travel is about exploration, we are on a continuous journey to make our work culture more inclusive. Spending time with us, whether you are at work or on holiday, enables you to relax and be yourself in a safe environment. We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

What you will be doing:
Within Criteo FP&A Revenue team we are looking for a talented FP&A analyst, based in Barcelona, to help analyze top line performance for marketing solution business segment. This role requires solid knowledge of FP&A processes, performance management and business modelling acumen as well as strong communication and influencing skills.
In this role, you will have the responsibility to:
Financial and business planning:
o Coordinate with multiple teams (Corporate FPA, Business planning team, Strategic & Commercial Finance etc.) to align end to end planning process and key deliverables
o Provide key assumptions for topline forecast through deep collaboration with analytics team
o Share insightful topline forecast/plan analysis to company senior leaderships
Financial modelling:
o Build financial models to support long-term market growth plan and business cases
o Collaborate with FP&A expense team to conduct profitability modelling and analysis
o Support Analytics and Corporate FPA to simulate scenarios for certain impacts on business
Financial reporting and analysis:
o Support actual vs budget / forecast / YoY and other gap analysis, at monthly/quarterly basis
o Leverage company datasource and reports to customize different reporting needs
o Collaborate with other business unit FPA to provide consolidated company view reporting
Ad-hoc project: including forecast process streamlining or tools improvements
Who you are:
At least 3 years experience in Financial Planning & Analysis in a public, multinational company, audit or consulting firm (Big 4)
Bachelor or Master degree in Finance
Good knowledge of P&L and general accounting process & procedure
Ability to deal with complexity and to handle multiple tasks concurrently
A "hands on" proactive and self-driven attitude is required; who enjoys challenges and thrives in a fast changing and demanding environment.
Client oriented mind with integrity and solid analytical skills, humble and self-aware
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to interact and influence senior management level
Fluent in English, other language skills appreciated
International experience with proven ability to work with people from different cultures is a plus
High proficiency in MS Office including Excel and Power Point. Skills on Power BI, Qlick, Tableau or any other data visualization tools is a plus.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Summary of the role
As the Senior Hospitality (HOS) Controlling Analyst, you’ll be the financial partner of the Media organization (Travel Audience) and support them by modeling, planning, and monitoring the implementation of the company strategy.

Your goal is to establish financial policies, procedures, and controls for the Media business unit. You’ll also provide reporting services to Travel Audience management as well as Hospitality Controlling team.

In this role you’ll
Manage financial planning and budgeting processes
Communicate guidelines, preparation, consolidation, review & submission of budgets and forecasts (Headcounts, Fixed Costs, Investments)
Coordinate within HOS Consolidation team and other Controlling teams to have accurate budgets, forecasts and LTP aligned with business unit guidelines
Analyze financial data and provide analyses to management to support their arbitrations and decision-making process

Monitor and report Travel Audience performance
Provide monthly financial status to management, including the preparation of different financial results and business metrics following corporate guidelines
Analyze and investigate material variances versus previous years, planning or forecast, business cases, or other P&L versions

Manage transactional and financial closing activities
Manage month-end closing in Travel Audience, ensuring all processes are closed within the target deadlines following Amadeus Group policies
Lead all estimation processes impacting financial statements
Ensure transparency and preparation of all supporting information

Serve as Travel Audience Business Partner
Build solid relationships with internal customers to understand their business needs and proactively support them
Deliver ad-hoc reports working closely with peers and different stakeholders, such as Commercial Finance or Commercial Operations to ensure a common understanding of the business that could lead in strategic business decisions

Champion continuous process improvement
Ensure accuracy in financial statements and implement efficient administrative and financial processes while using IT applications
Suggest alternatives, improvements, and new techniques in processes, flows, operational models and plans

About the ideal candidate
University degree in Business Administration Accounting, Finance, or Mathematics
At least 3 years of experience as consultant or in a multinational firm
Experience in SAP Finance, SAP BW/4Hana; Salesforce is a plus
Advanced knowledge of Excel functions (macros)
Proficient in English (both verbal and written); Spanish is a plus
Ability to clearly communicate financial information to a wide range of audiences
Ability to handle and prioritize tasks to meet tight deadlines

What we can offer you
Add your voice to a multicultural team of 16,000+ professionals
Work at one of the world’s top 15 software companies
Challenge yourself to find solutions to complex problems
Competitive compensation and benefits package

Role/Purpose: Provide analysis and support to License Compliance Sales efforts through the in-depth knowledge of the TOU and Autodesk customer data. Effectively supporting compliance campaigns and programs through analytic tasks and analysis to drive revenue and compliance. Cross collaboration on a global level and detailed process development to ensure consistency and alignment of customer reporting.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Perform in-depth analyses of audit/inventory data provided by customers using a variety of database tools.
Identify and provide a written analysis of actual customer Autodesk installations, environments and deployment based on inventory data provided by customers, utilizing Autodesk reporting tool (PowerBI, MS Excel, etc).
Assign compliance resolution amount values to license compliance violation.
Review and summarize audit findings with Sales partners and/or customers.
Recommend changes to the existing analysis process to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Provide procedural change recommendations to simplify process/procedures by working with other analysts and managers worldwide on potential solutions.
Serve as a trusted advisor, trainer, and consultant to Autodesk Global License Compliance organization regarding Autodesk product installations.
Stay informed on changes in Autodesk policies and strategies and be able to explain the impacts to partners.

Data Ops Engineer (f/m)
100% | Madrid
This is a unique opportunity for an open-minded person with a passion for data and a strong technical background but who just as much likes to get things done with real implications and observe the theories applied in the energy trading environment. As a Data Ops Engineer, you will gain expertise in Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, monitoring and visualization tools and operability of productive machine learning projects
Join us, be part and collaborate actively with the company wide community of Advanced Analytics!
What you will do
Monitor big data and advanced analytics use-cases that are running in a productive cloud environment, including incident management
Enhance and maintain a proactive ETL pipeline monitoring framework
Produce, maintain and optimize code based on clear specifications
Integrate and continuously improve specific framework components
Coordinate the operational work streams with the cloud infrastructure service provider
Develop ETL data pipelines and data connectors
Data quality check implementations and deliveries
Working closely with Data Engineers and Scientists within a data-dedicated Team

What you bring & who you are
University degree in data science, computer science, engineering or similar
Knowledge in maintaining and monitoring productive applications
Experience with programming languages such as Python
Experience in SQL database and data management
Proficient in English
Familiar with Cloud Frameworks is a plus
What we offer
Lifelong learning
Get off to a flying start with the induction programme at the Axpo Academy. And don't stop there: we offer a wide range of courses and training, including flexible e-learning. Benefit from time and financial support on your learning and development journey, and take advantage of initiatives like 'Lunch & Learn, individual development plans, coaching and talent management.
Your choice
Flexibility comes in many forms. How about an annualised hours model, part-time position (even for managers) or the freedom to choose when and where you work? Axpo offers all these as well as the chance to buy additional vacation days if you need them.
You're covered
Investing in your future starts now. Axpo pays generous employer contributions to the pension fund. If you get sick, we'll cover your salary in full for up to two years. And because safety's a priority, we offer private accident insurance for everyone as well as reduced premiums for health insurance.
The whole package
As a market leader in our field, we offer competitive salaries across Axpo including a variable compensation component. Important to us is our commitment to equal pay for equal work.
About us
Axpo Iberia, a subsidiary of the Axpo Group, was established in Spain in 2002 and manages the most important independent portfolio of renewable energies on the Iberian Peninsula. We offer our customers in Spain and Portugal products and services in the fields of energy and gas supply, energy management for producers of renewable energies and heat and power cogeneration, as well as trading of raw materials, biomass and CO2. Axpo is Switzerland's largest producer of renewable energy, as well as an international leader in energy trading and the marketing of solar and wind power. At its headquarters in Switzerland and in 30 countries across Europe as well as the US, around 5,000 employees use state-of-the-art technology to develop sustainable, innovative energy solutions.
More information
About the team
Axpo Solutions has decided to accelerate the Advanced Analytics transformation and the wider deployment of model-based trading across the different commodity desks and countries. For such a goal, the Advanced Analytics team has been created as a center of excellence for the adoption of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science across the whole company. You will be part of an international team sitting between Madrid and Baden (Switzerland) that focuses on end-to-end implementation of high impact use cases across Europe and commodity desks. As such, we also maintain regular contact with teams of traders, quantitative analysts as well as the management, who is a strong supporter of the ML-based trading approach.

Job Title: Senior Manager Analytics, Channel Marketing- Spain Remote
Job Description:
Who We Are:
Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more – all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do:
Lead a team of analysts in the Channel Marketing data domain; build career objectives and craft their learning and development plans
Develop and lead routines to facilitate cross-team sharing, collaboration, and cohesion
Build relationships with relevant specialists in the Data & Analytics community, e.g., the Experimentation Center of Excellence, Analytics Guild, Marketing Analytics, etc.
Guide data analysis and modeling including bringing ideas for novel or unexplored data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to improve how we build data products
Guide insights sharing and visualization of results to provide meaningful recommendations to our Channel Marketing specialists, to our data product teams and to the business
Tell the story of our data products’ performance working in partnership with our data product teams

Your Qualifications:
At Vistaprint, we value the experiences that individual team members add to our culture. Please don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications, we look forward to learning more about you!
8+ years of experience in analytics with ideally 5+ years in an eCommerce or Marketing environment. Bachelor degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.
People management background for ideally 5+ team members
Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (especially Looker would be a huge plus)
Experience in partnering and leading multi-functional teams

Nice to Have:
Proficiency in other programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)
Good understanding of Channel Marketing use cases

Why You'll Love Working Here:
Being at Vistaprint means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.
Vistaprint has received numerous recognitions including a perfect score of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s 2021 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) naming us a Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality. We also earned a place as one of the best remote-first workplaces in the U.S. and on the Boston Best Places to Work list from Built In. In addition, Vistaprint’s CEO, Robert Keane, was recently honored with Comparably’s Best CEOs award, listing him among the top CEOs according to employees. Vistaprint offers numerous support systems including Employee Resource Groups like Pride, Mosaic, and Women in Technology, and special interests communities to foster awareness, respect, and inclusion within the workplace.

We're Remote-First:
In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers them to be their best. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so and when in-person collaboration will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 30 US States as well as several countries in Europe, including Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us:
As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint creates customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We are the marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For more than 20 years, we have helped small businesses look and feel credible through high-quality marketing products and solutions that include signage, logo apparel, promotional products, face masks, flyers, postcards, business cards, websites and digital marketing. With Vistaprint, small businesses are able to create and customize their marketing with easy-to-use digital tools and design-templates, or by receiving expert graphic design support. In 2020, Vistaprint acquired 99designs to expand its design offering via a worldwide community of more than 150,000 talented designers to make it easy for designers and clients to work together to create designs they love. Vistaprint is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

Company Description

Denodo is the leader in data virtualization – providing unmatched performance, unified access to the broadest range of enterprise, Big Data, cloud and unstructured sources, and the agilest data services provisioning and governance – at less than half the cost of traditional data integration. Denodo’s customers have gained significant business agility and ROI by creating a unified virtual data layer that serves strategic enterprise-wide information needs for agile BI, big data analytics, web and cloud integration, single-view applications, and SOA data services across every major industry. Founded in 1999, Denodo is privately held.

Job Description

The Opportunity
Denodo wants to offer its customers several ways of deploying Denodo Platform based solutions. One of those ways is providing Denodo Platform as a managed service on hybrid cloud environments with different flavours (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).
The Director of Cloud & SaaS Solutions will be leading the development of this area in Denodo.
Key Duties & Responsibilities
The Director Cloud & SaaS Solutions is responsible for the strategic and tactical leadership of the Denodo Services delivered on Cloud: owner of the roadmap while still keeping the fingers on the pulse of day-to-day project activities; with a focus on meeting requirements, assuring the overall quality of deliverables, ensuring overall stakeholder satisfaction and making a contribution to the overall revenue of the company.
The Director Cloud & SaaS Solutions is a pivotal role responsible for building and leading cross-functional Denodo and Partner teams to ensure successful delivery of Denodo services on the Cloud:
Manage Denodo Services on Cloud roadmap in collaboration with Denodo technical departments.
Maintain strong relationships with main cloud providers (like AWS, Azure, Google Cloud,...) as advisors and as partners for marketing, evangelization and channel sales actions.
Collaborate with Denodo executives in defining business strategy, revenue models and go to market initiatives.
Build and nurture C-level relationships across top accounts to solidify Denodo partnership and commitment to the customer.
Focus on customer intimacy – deliver business impact and innovation to a customer’s business by truly understanding our customers’ key business issues and opportunities.
Listening to customers closely and delighting them with our user experience and service.
Attend Q&A sessions with analysts and related third parties to position Denodo in reference solutions for the market.
Supervise the implementation of the services and their continuous evolution in features.
Oversee and execute process improvements and the development of policies, procedures, methods, and tools in support of delivery.
Build the needed team to operate globally the services with the appropriate mix among Denodo staff and partner or provider services.
Be accountable of the budget assigned and the revenue expected.
Embody company values and provide exemplary leadership.

Qualifications
Strong technical flavor. A technical degree and MS or MBA.
End to End Business Management and Operational Excellence.
At least 10 years of experience demonstrating management and leadership experience.
Significant experience leading a services organization or software development organization.
Demonstrated experience in international environments.
Fluent in English. Additional languages will be a plus.
Demonstrated relationships with C-level executives.
Strong Internal and external stakeholder management and communication.
Transformational thinker and leader for taking the business to the next level through disruptive thinking and innovation.
People and Organisational leadership.
Ability to work independently and in a distributed team environment, and to deliver on detailed strategy.
Demonstrated success in consistently delivering revenue numbers, producing accurate forecasts, while maintaining a focus on profitability.
Willing to travel around once a month.

Additional Information

Denodo is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Denodo will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities in accordance with applicable law.

Job Title: Middle Market Business Analyst Dutch speaking desired (not essential) - FTC 3 months
Job Description:
The Business Analyst Role is part of a process improvement project team. This role reports to the CE Head of Middle Market operational Efficiency and indirectly to the Benelux Country President. The role will be based in Madrid, Spain.

The overall purpose of the role is to provide valuable inputs, generate required outputs and materials, coordinate and support projects related to the Benelux business.

1) Liaise with key stakeholder to define processes, variances from standard process by business and function.

2) Identify and assess process reengineering opportunities.

3) Review and refine the scope of business for Benelux.

4) Identify risks and challenges and define in conjunction with stakeholders, the best solution to overcome these.

5) Estimate cost and benefits of opportunities identified.

6) Define the approach, process, calendar of the implementation phase of the projects.

The successful candidate will interact very closely with the Benelux Country president, the Benelux stakeholders, and will act as the interface with the project teams.

Key Responsibilities:
Liaise with key stakeholder to define processes, variances from standard process by business and function:

Map business processes according to the defined rules and standards, for all major lines in scope.

Ensure process documents remain applicable and are kept up to date in the central shared repository.

Identify variances specific to Benelux.

Identify and assess process reengineering opportunities.

Identify opportunities for improvement and/or automation through comparison of current Benelux process maps and CE general process maps.

Review and refine business in scope for Benelux. In conjunction with the Benelux Country president, line of business leaders, assess and review the underwriting criteria:

Typology of business in scope.

Rules for business in scope.

Volume of business in scope.

Identify risks and challenges and define in conjunction with stakeholders, the best solution to overcome these.

Through discussion with various stakeholders and Subject matter experts, identify the risks to the projects.

Define the various solutions available to the project team to mitigate these risks and provide recommendations.

Keep track of all assumptions and hypothesis driving the numbers, calculations and project plans.

Estimate cost and benefits of opportunities identified.

In conjunction with Finance and the project team, estimate the benefits associated with the project, as well as its phasing.

Assist the CE Head of MM operational Excellence to create the cost benefit analysis and submission pack as necessary.

Define the approach, process, calendar of the implementation phase of the project.

In conjunction with the various stakeholders and project team, make recommendations and agree on the best approach to implement the project.

Keep a clear track of the risk/benefit/mitigants along the project.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
Ideally a good Understanding of the general Dutch and Belgian insurance market.

Understanding of the Chubb culture, Chubb portfolio of risks.

High degree of MS office tools including advanced Excel skills.

Experience using MS Visio.

Ability to use the various internal reporting tool and data.

Ability to identify correctly policies.

Fluent in Dutch and English. French is a plus.

Experience in conducting complex Business Change/Business transformation.

Job Title: Middle Market Business Analyst German speaking – FTC 3 months
Job Description:
The Business Analyst Role is part of a process improvement project team.The role will be based in Madrid, Spain.

The overall purpose of the role is to provide valuable inputs, generate required outputs and materials, coordinate and support projects related to the German business.

The successful candidate will interact very closely with the German Country president, the German country stakeholders, and will act as the interface with the project teams.

Key Responsibilities:
Liaise with key stakeholder to define processes, variances from standard process by business and function:

Map business processes according to the defined rules and standards, for all major lines in scope.

Ensure process documents remain applicable and are kept up to date in the central shared repository.

Identify variances specific to Germany.

Identify and assess process reengineering opportunities.

Identify opportunities for improvement and/or automation through comparison of current German process maps and CE general process maps.

Review and refine business in scope for Germany. In conjunction with the German Country president, line of business leaders, assess and review the underwriting criteria:

Typology of business in scope

Rules for business in scope

Volume of business in scope

Identify risks and challenges and define in conjunction with stakeholders, the best solution to overcome these.

Through discussion with various stakeholders and Subject matter experts, identify the risks to the projects.

Define the various solutions available to the project team to mitigate these risks and provide recommendations.

Keep track of all assumptions and hypothesis driving the numbers, calculations and project plans.

Estimate cost and benefits of opportunities identified.

In conjunction with Finance and the project team, estimate the benefits associated with the project, as well as its phasing.

Assist the CE Head of MM operational Excellence to create the cost benefit analysis and submission pack as necessary.

Define the approach, process, calendar of the implementation phase of the project.

In conjunction with the various stakeholders and project team, make recommendations and agree on the best approach to implement the project.

Keep a clear track of the risk/benefit/mitigants along the project.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
Ideally a good Understanding of the general German insurance market.

Understanding of the Chubb culture, Chubb portfolio of risks.

High degree of MS office tools including advanced Excel skills.

Experience using MS Visio.

Ability to use the various internal reporting tool and data.

Ability to identify correctly policies.

Fluent in German and English.

Experience in conducting complex Business Change/Business transformation.

Experience with process mapping and re-engineering.

Ability to interact with various seniority levels in the company.

Ability to deliver under pressure both timely and with quality.
